function.name: loadPlugin
function.description: Lua only. Loads a CoppeliaSim plugin

param.name: pluginName
param.description: the name of the plugin, including version number, e.g. simIK, simIK-2-0, etc.

param.name: namespace
param.description: a map containing the variables and functions offered by the plugin

function.name: unloadPlugin
function.description: Lua only. Unloads a CoppeliaSim plugin

param.name: namespace
param.description: the map returned by loadPlugin

param.name: options
param.description: an optional map. If options.force is set, then the plugin will be forceably unloaded, even if other scripts still depend on it

function.name: sim.acquireLock
function.description: Allows to have CoppeliaSim wait for a threaded code section to be executed without interruption. Locking is cumulative

function.name: sim.releaseLock
function.description: Counterpart function to sim.acquireLock(). Unlocking is cumulative

function.name: sim.setStepping
function.description:
Enables or disables the stepping operation mode for a threaded script. If enabled, then the current script has to trigger each simulation step explicitly, via sim.step(). Is applied cumulatively, i.e. if the stepping operation mode is enabled n times, it needs to be disabled n times to return to the initial state
(Lua specific: in stepping operation mode, automatic thread interruptions, i.e. preemptive threading, is supressed)

param.name: enable
param.description: enable state of thread interruption

param.name: prevStepLevel
param.description: previous level of thread interruption. When 0, thread interruption was not enabled previously

function.name: sim.step
function.description: Triggers the next simulation step, when in stepping operation mode. When simulation is running, then sim.step only returns once the simulation time has changed

function.name: sim.yield
function.description: Same as sim.step()

function.name: simAddDrawingObject
function.description: Creates a drawing object that will be displayed in the scene. Drawing objects are containers that hold several items of a given type. This can be used for several different applications (simulation of paint, simulation of welding seam, display of 3D objects, etc.). Drawing objects created in a simulation script will be automatically removed at simulation end

param.name: objectType
param.description: a drawing object type combined with attributes

param.name: size
param.description: size of the item (width of lines or size of points are in pixels, other sizes are in meters

param.name: duplicateTolerance
param.description: if different from 0.0, then a call to simAddDrawingObjectItem will only add the item if there is no other item within duplicateTolerance distance. Useful to avoid adding a too high density of points, is however not appropriate when using a large number of points (slower operation). Applicable only for single vertex items.

param.name: parentObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the scene object where the drawing items should keep attached to (if the scene object moves, the drawing items will also move), or -1 if the drawing items are relative to the world (fixed)

param.name: maxItemCount
param.description: maximum number of items this object can hold. 0 uses a default size of 1000.

param.name: color
param.description: default color (pointer to 3 rgb values). Can be nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: handle of the drawing object if successful, -1 otherwise

function.name: sim.createDrawingObject
function.description: Creates a drawing object that will be displayed in the scene. Drawing objects are containers that hold several items of a given type. This can be used for several different applications (simulation of paint, simulation of welding seam, display of 3D objects, etc.). Drawing objects created in a simulation script will be automatically removed at simulation end

param.name: objectType
param.description: a drawing object type combined with attributes

param.name: size
param.description: size of the item (width of lines or size of points are in pixels, other sizes are in meters

param.name: duplicateTolerance
param.description: if different from 0.0, then a call to sim.addDrawingObjectItem will only add the item if there is no other item within duplicateTolerance distance. Useful to avoid adding a too high density of points, is however not appropriate when using a large number of points (slower operation). Applicable only for single vertex items.

param.name: parentObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the scene object where the drawing items should keep attached to (if the scene object moves, the drawing items will also move), or -1 if the drawing items are relative to the world (fixed)

param.name: maxItemCount
param.description: maximum number of items this object can hold. 0 uses a default size of 1000.

param.name: color
param.description: default color (3 rgb values). Can be None/nil

param.name: drawingObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the drawing object

function.name: simAddDrawingObjectItem
function.description: Adds an item (or clears all items) to a previously inserted drawing object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a previously added drawing object

param.name: itemData
param.description: data relative to an item. If the item is a point item, 3 values are required (x;y;z). If the item is a line item, 6 values are required, etc. Specifying nullptr will empty the drawing object

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. If the point was added, then the return value is >0, if it was not added (e.g. drawing object is saturated or the item was merged with an existing item), then the return value will be 0.

function.name: simAddForce
function.description: Adds a non-central force to a shape object that is dynamically enabled. Added forces are cumulative, applied relative to the center of mass, and are reset to zero after sim.handleDynamics was called (or by using the following flag: sim.handleflag_resetforcetorque)

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of a dynamically enabled shape. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_resetforcetorque in order to clear the accumulated force and torque.

param.name: position
param.description: pointer to 3 values that represent the relative position where the force should be applied.

param.name: force
param.description: pointer to 3 values that represent the force (in relative coordinates) to add.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: sim.addForce
function.description: Adds a non-central force to a shape object that is dynamically enabled. Added forces are cumulative, applied relative to the center of mass, and are reset to zero after sim.handleDynamics was called (or by using the following flag: sim.handleflag_resetforcetorque)

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of a dynamically enabled shape. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_resetforcetorque in order to clear the accumulated force and torque.

param.name: position
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the relative position where the force should be applied.

param.name: force
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the force (in relative coordinates) to add.

function.name: simAddForceAndTorque
function.description: Adds a force and/or torque to a shape object that is dynamically enabled. Forces are applied at the center of mass. Added forces and torques are cumulative, and are reset to zero after sim.handleDynamics was called (or by using the following flags: sim.handleflag_resetforce and/or sim.handleflag_resettorque)

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of a dynamically enabled shape. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_resetforce and/or sim.handleflag_resettorque in order to clear the accumulated force or torque.

param.name: force
param.description: pointer to 3 values that represent the force (in absolute coordinates) to add. Can be nullptr.

param.name: torque
param.description: pointer to 3 values that represent the torque (in absolute coordinates) to add. Can be nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simAddGraphCurve
function.description: Adds or updates a graph curve. A graph curve is persistent, but can be removed with sim.destroyGraphCurve

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph

param.name: curveName
param.description: name of the curve

param.name: dim
param.description: dimension of the curve. Valid values are 2 or 3

param.name: streamIds
param.description: a pointer to 2 or 3 graph streams (x/y curves require 2 stream IDs, xyz curves require 3 stream IDs). Indicate -1 for a missing stream, in which case a default value will be used instead

param.name: defaultValues
param.description: a pointer to 2 or 3 default values

param.name: unitStr
param.description: string describing the unit of the curve. Can be nullptr

param.name: options
param.description: bit-coded: bit0 is not used. If bit1 is set (2), the label is not visible. If bit2 is set (4), the points are not linked.

param.name: color
param.description: rgb-triplet, with values in [0.0-1.0], indicating the color of the stream. Can be nullptr

param.name: curveWidth
param.description: the width of an xyz curve

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the id of the created/updated curve

function.name: sim.addGraphCurve
function.description: Adds or updates a graph curve. A graph curve is persistent, but can be removed with sim.destroyGraphCurve

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph

param.name: curveName
param.description: name of the curve

param.name: dim
param.description: dimension of the curve. Valid values are 2 or 3

param.name: streamIds
param.description: array of 2 or 3 graph streams (x/y curves require 2 stream IDs, xyz curves require 3 stream IDs). Indicate -1 for a missing stream, in which case a default value will be used instead

param.name: defaultValues
param.description: array of 2 or 3 default values

param.name: unitStr
param.description: string describing the unit of the curve. Can be None/nil

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 is not used.
If bit1 is set (2), the label is not visible
If bit2 is set (4), the points are not linked

param.name: color
param.description: bit0 is not used.

param.name: curveWidth
param.description: If bit1 is set (2), the label is not visible

param.name: curveId
param.description: id of the created/updated curve

function.name: simAddGraphStream
function.description: Adds or updates a graph stream. A graph stream is persistent, but can be removed with sim.destroyGraphCurve

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph

param.name: streamName
param.description: name of the stream

param.name: unitStr
param.description: string describing the unit of the stream. Can be nullptr

param.name: options
param.description: bit-coded: if bit0 is set (1), the stream is not visible. If bit1 is set (2), the label is not visible. If bit2 is set (4), the points are not linked.

param.name: color
param.description: rgb-triplet, with values in [0.0-1.0], indicating the color of the stream. Can be nullptr

param.name: cyclicRange
param.description: can be used with cyclic values (e.g. angles) for correct data interpretation during stream data transformation . Set to 0 if not used

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the id of the created/updated stream

function.name: sim.addGraphStream
function.description: Adds or updates a graph stream. A graph stream is persistent, but can be removed with sim.destroyGraphCurve

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph

param.name: streamName
param.description: name of the stream

param.name: unitStr
param.description: string describing the unit of the stream. Can be None/nil

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
if bit0 is set (1), the stream is not visible
if bit1 is set (2), the label is not visible
if bit2 is set (4), the points are not linked

param.name: color
param.description: if bit0 is set (1), the stream is not visible

param.name: cyclicRange
param.description: if bit1 is set (2), the label is not visible

param.name: streamId
param.description: id of the created/updated stream

function.name: simAddItemToCollection
function.description: Adds an item to a collection

param.name: collectionHandle
param.description: the handle of a collection.

param.name: what
param.description:
the type of object (or group of objects) to add. Following are allowed values:
sim.handle_single
(for a single object),
sim.handle_all
(for all objects in the scene),
sim.handle_tree
(for a tree of objects), or
sim.handle_chain
(for a chain of objects (i.e. an inverted tree)).

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: the handle of an object.

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded options:
bit 0 set (1): the specified object (or group of objects) is removed from the collection. Otherwise it is added.
bit 1 set (2): the specified object is not included in the group of objects, if sim.handle_tree or sim.handle_chain is specified (i.e. the tree base or tip is excluded).

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful.

function.name: simAddLog
function.description: Adds a log message that will be output in the console or status bar

param.name: pluginName
param.description:
the name of the plugin that outputs the message. e.g.
simIK

param.name: verbosity
param.description: the verbosity level . Most appropriate values are sim.verbosity_errors (for errors), sim.verbosity_warnings (for warning) and sim.verbosity_infos.

param.name: message
param.description: the message. Set to nullptr to clear the status bar

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful.

function.name: sim.addLog
function.description: Adds a log message that will be output in the console or status bar

param.name: verbosity
param.description: the verbosity level . Most appropriate values are sim.verbosity_scripterrors (for errors), sim.verbosity_scriptwarnings (for warning) and sim.verbosity_scriptinfos. Combine with sim.verbosity_undecorated if you wish to output the naked message. sim.verbosity_scripterrors will additionaly raise an error.

param.name: message
param.description: the message. None/nil clears the status bar

function.name: sim.addParticleObject
function.description: Adds a particle object that will be simulated and displayed in the scene. Particle objects are containers that hold several items (particles) of a given type. This can be used for several different applications (e.g. simulation of air/water jets)

param.name: objectType
param.description: a particle object type combined with attributes

param.name: size
param.description: diameter of the particles (spheres)

param.name: density
param.description: density of the particles

param.name: parameters
param.description:
an array of values, allowing to specify additional parameters. Can be None/nil. Values come in pair (an integer indicating what parameter, and a float indicating the parameter value. Following indicates the parameters:
0: Bullet friction coefficient (default: 0.0)
1: Bullet restitution coefficient (default: 0.0)
2: ODE friction coefficient (default: 0.0)
3: ODE soft ERP value (default: 0.2)
4: ODE soft CFM values (default: 0.0)
5: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex linear drag parameter (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*parameter)
6: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex quadratic drag parameter (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*v*parameter)
7: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex linear drag parameter in air (z>0) if sim.particle_water was specified (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*parameter)
8: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex quadratic drag parameter in air (z>0) if sim.particle_water was specified (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*v*parameter)
9: Vortex friction (default: 0.0)
10: Vortex restitution (default: 0.0)
11: Vortex restitution threshold (default: 0.001)
12: Vortex compliance (default: 0.0)
13: Vortex damping (default: 0.0)
14: Vortex adhesive force (default: 0.0)
15: Newton static friction (default: 0.0)
16: Newton kinetic friction (default: 0.0)
17: Newton restitution (default: 0.0)
If a parameter is not set, then its default value is used

param.name: lifeTime
param.description: 0: Bullet friction coefficient (default: 0.0)

param.name: maxItemCount
param.description: 1: Bullet restitution coefficient (default: 0.0)

param.name: color
param.description: 2: ODE friction coefficient (default: 0.0)

param.name: particleObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the particle object

function.name: sim.addParticleObjectItem
function.description: Adds an item (or clears all items) to a previously inserted particle object

param.name: particleObjectHandle
param.description: handle of a previously added particle object

param.name: itemData
param.description: data relative to an item. All items (particles) require at least 6 values: p1x, p1y, p1z, p2x, p2y, p2z with p1 is the particle start position, p2-p1 is the particle initial velocity vector. Auxiliary values might be required depending on the particle object attributes. See the particle object type combined with attributes for more information. If None/nil, the particle object is emptied of all its items

function.name: simAdjustView
function.description: Adjusts parameters of a view

param.name: viewHandleOrIndex
param.description: the handle of the view (can also be a floating view), or the index of the view.

param.name: associatedViewableObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that you wish to associate with the view. Must be a viewable object. Can also be -1, in which case the view is emptied

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0-bit5 = 0
bit6 (64) set=floating view is removed at simulation end
bit7 (128) set=floating view is ignored during a scene save operation
bit8 (256) set=the view is not modified. The return value of the function indicates if the view still exists (2), or does not exist anymore (1). No error is generated.
bit9 (512) set=the view is not modified. The return value of the function represents the object associated with the view.

param.name: return
param.description: a value >0 in case of success

function.name: sim.adjustView
function.description: Adjusts parameters of a view

param.name: viewHandleOrIndex
param.description: handle of the view (can also be a floating view), or the index of the view.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that you wish to associate with the view. Must be a viewable object. Can also be -1, in which case the view is emptied

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0-bit5 = 0
bit6 (64) set=floating view is removed at simulation end
bit7 (128) set=floating view is ignored during a scene save operation
bit8 (256) set=the view is not modified. The return value of the function indicates if the view still exists (2), or does not exist anymore (1). No error is generated.
bit9 (512) set=the view is not modified. The return value of the function represents the object associated with the view.

param.name: res
param.description: a value >0 in case of success

function.name: simAlignShapeBB
function.description: Reorients the bounding box of a shape, while keeping the shape frame in place. The shape's inertia properties are unaffected

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: pose
param.description: pose describing the new orientation of the shape's bounding box. The pose is expressed as [x y z qx qy qz qw], where the positional part is ignored. A nullptr pose, or a pose containing only zeros will align the bounding box with the mesh's natural bounding box

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. 0 if the bounding box could not be reoriented (the bounding box of primitive shapes cannot be reoriented), otherwise 1.

function.name: sim.alignShapeBB
function.description: Reorients the bounding box of a shape, while keeping the shape frame in place. The shape's inertia properties are unaffected

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: p
param.description: pose describing the new orientation of the shape's bounding box. The pose is expressed as [x y z qx qy qz qw], where the positional part is ignored. A pose containing only zeros aligns the bounding box with the mesh's natural bounding box

function.name: simAnnounceSceneContentChange
function.description: Announces a change in the scene. This is required for the undo/redo function to operate properly when performing changes via the API. Only call this function directly after a change was made through a dialog element (e.g. a checkbox was checked/unchecked) and that change was reported to the scene. What this call will do is following: the whole scene will be serialized (saved) to memory as a "scene image" and compared to a previously memorized "scene image". If both images are same, then the last image is discarded, otherwise only the changes between the two images are memorized. A call to this function has no effect (and doesn't generate any error) when called during simulation or when in edit mode.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, 0 if nothing was memorized, or 1 if changes were memorized.

function.name: sim.announceSceneContentChange
function.description: Announces a change in the scene. This is required for the undo/redo function to operate properly when performing changes via the API. Only call this function directly after a change was made through a dialog element (e.g. a checkbox was checked/unchecked) and that change was reported to the scene. What this call will do is following: the whole scene will be serialized (saved) to memory as a "scene image" and compared to a previously memorized "scene image". If both images are same, then the last image is discarded, otherwise only the changes between the two images are memorized. A call to this function has no effect (and doesn't generate any error) when called during simulation or when in edit mode.

function.name: simApplyTexture
function.description: Applies a texture via texture coordinates to a shape

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: textureCoordinates
param.description: UV texture coordinates. For each of the shape's triangle, there should be exactly 3 UV texture coordinate pairs

param.name: textCoordSize
param.description: size of the textureCoordinate array

param.name: texture
param.description: RGB or RGBA texture

param.name: textureResolution
param.description: X/Y resolution of the texture

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated
bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions)
bit2: unused, keep unset
bit3: unused, keep unset
bit4: if set (16), then the texture is RGBA, otherwise it is RGB
bit5: if set (32), then the texture is horizontally flipped
bit6: if set (64), then the texture is vertically flipped

param.name: return
param.description: The ID of the texture, or -1 in case of an error

function.name: simAuxiliaryConsoleClose
function.description: Closes an auxiliary console window

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description: handle of the console window, previously returned by simAuxiliaryConsoleOpen

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. 0 if the console doesn't exist (anymore), in which case no error is generated. 1 if the console window was closed.

function.name: sim.auxiliaryConsoleClose
function.description: Closes an auxiliary console window

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description: handle of the console window, previously returned by sim.auxiliaryConsoleOpen

function.name: simAuxiliaryConsoleOpen
function.description: Opens an auxiliary console window for text display. This console window is different from the application main console window. Console window handles are shared across all simulator scenes

param.name: title
param.description: title of the console window

param.name: maxLines
param.description: number of text lines that can be displayed and buffered

param.name: mode
param.description:
bit-coded value:
bit0 (1) set indicates that the console window automatically closes at simulation end
bit1 (2) set indicates that lines will be wrapped
bit2 (4) set indicates that the user can close the console window
bit3 (8) is not used
bit4 (16) set indicates that the console will not automatically hide when the user switches to another scene

param.name: position
param.description: bit0 (1) set indicates that the console window automatically closes at simulation end

param.name: size
param.description: bit1 (2) set indicates that lines will be wrapped

param.name: textColor
param.description: bit2 (4) set indicates that the user can close the console window

param.name: backgroundColor
param.description: bit3 (8) is not used

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. Otherwise a console window handle

param.name: mode

function.name: sim.auxiliaryConsoleShow

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description:
handle of the console window, previously returned by sim.auxiliaryConsoleOpen . When combined with
sim.handleflag_extended
, then the function will simply query the visibility state of the console.

param.name: showState

function.name: sim.callScriptFunction
function.description: Calls a script function (from a plugin , the main client application , or from another script). This represents a user callback inside of a script. The target script must be initialized for this call to succeed, e.g. when calling simulation scripts , then simulation must be running

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: the handle of the script, or sim.handle_self to target the current script. See sim.getScript

param.name: functionName
param.description: the function to call.

param.name: inArg1
param.description: argument 1 to be handed over to the called function.

param.name: inArg2
param.description: argument 2 to be handed over to the called function.

param.name: inArg3
param.description: argument 3 to be handed over to the called function. Additional arguments are allowed.

param.name: outArg
param.description: any number of return values from the called function.

function.name: simCallScriptFunctionEx
function.description:
Calls a script function (from a plugin , the main client application , or from another script). This represents a user callback inside of a script. The target script must be initialized for this call to succeed, e.g. when calling simulation scripts , then simulation must be running
Data exchange between a plugin and a script happens via a stack . Reading and writing arguments from/to the stack gives you a maximum of flexibility, and you wil be able to exchange also complex data structures. But it can also be tedious and error prone. Use instead the helper classes located in
programming/include/simStack
: they will greatly simplify the task. Have a look at the example plugins simSkeleton and simSkel

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: the handle of the script, or -1 for the sandbox script, or -2 for the main script

param.name: functionName
param.description: the function to call.

param.name: stackId
param.description: a stack handle . The stack represents the function's in/out values. See also the available stack functions .

param.name: return

function.name: checkOctreePointOccupancy
function.description: Checks whether the provided points collide with the OC tree voxels

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: pts
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: ptCnt
param.description: pointer to the points specified as x/y/z coordinates

param.name: tag
param.description: number of points contained in pts

param.name: location
param.description: pointer to a tag value, receiving the tag value of the voxel that collides with a single point. If several points are tested, then this pointer is ignored. Can be nullptr.

param.name: reserved
param.description:
pointer to a uint64 value, which specifies the location of the voxel that collides with a single point. If several points are tested, then this pointer is ignored. Can be nullptr. The location value is coded in following way:
bit0 - bit5: the depth level of the voxel in the OC tree structure (1-63).
bit6 - bit63: a triple bit-value for each depth level. triple bit-values represent the node location relative to the parent node:
0: (-1,-1,-1)
1: (+1,-1,-1)
2: (-1,+1,-1)
3: (+1,+1,-1)
4: (-1,-1,+1)
5: (+1,-1,+1)
6: (-1,+1,+1)
7: (+1,+1,+1)

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, 0 if the points do not collide with the voxels, 1 if the points collide with the voxels

function.name: sim.checkOctreePointOccupancy
function.description: Checks whether the provided points collide with the OC tree voxels

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: res
param.description: 0 if the points do not collide with the voxels, 1 if the points collide with the voxels

param.name: tag
param.description: tag value of the voxel that collides with a single point. If several points are tested, this return value should be ignored

param.name: locLow
param.description: value specifying the location of the voxel that collides with a single point. If several points are tested, then this return value should be ignored

function.name: simCheckVisionSensor
function.description: Checks whether the vision sensor detects the indicated entity. Detection is silent (no visual feedback) compared to sim.handleVisionSensor . The vision callback functions will be called on the acquired image. Also, the visibility state of the entity is overridden if the entity is an object

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor object

param.name: entityHandle
param.description: handle of entity to detect (object or collection), or sim.handle_all to detect all detectable objects

param.name: auxValues
param.description: by default CoppeliaSim returns one packet of 15 auxiliary values: the minimum of intensity, red, green, blue, depth value, the maximum of intensity, red, green, blue, depth value, and the average of intensity, red, green, blue, depth value. Additional packets can be appended in the vision callback functions . AuxValues can be nullptr. The user is in charge of releasing the auxValues buffer with simReleaseBuffer (*auxValues).

param.name: auxValuesCount
param.description: contains information about the number of auxiliary value packets and packet sizes returned in auxValues. The first value is the number of packets, the second is the size of packet1, the third is the size of packet2, etc. Can be nullptr if auxValues is also nullptr. The user is in charge of releasing the auxValuesCount buffer with simReleaseBuffer (*auxValuesCount)

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise 0 (no detection) or 1 (detection)

function.description: Checks whether the vision sensor detects the indicated entity. Detection is silent (no visual feedback) compared to sim.handleVisionSensor . param.name: auxPacket1
param.description: packet of 15 auxiliary values: the minimum of intensity, red, green, blue, depth value, the maximum of intensity, red, green, blue, depth value, and the average of intensity, red, green, blue, depth value

param.name: auxPacket2
param.description: additional auxiliary value packet (e.g. from an image processing component)

function.name: simConvexDecompose
function.description: Calculates the convex decomposition of a shape using the HACD or V-HACD algorithms

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape to operate on

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the specified shape will be morphed into its convex decomposition. Otherwise, the convex decomposition will smply be added to the scene
bit1 set (2): specified convex decomposition parameters will be displayed in a dialog, allowing the user to modify them.
bit2 set (4): same convex decomposition parameters will be used as a previous call to this function. Only when this bit is set can the convex decomposition parameters be omitted.
bit3 set (8): HACD: extra points will be added when computing the concavity
bit4 set (16): HACD: faces points will be added when computing the concavity
bit5 (32): reserved. Do not set
bit6 (64): reserved. Do not set
bit7 set (128): the V-HACD algorithm will be used. If not set, the HACD algorithm will be used.
bit8 set (256): V-HACD: pca is enabled (default is disabled).
bit9 set (512): V-HACD: tetrahedron-based approximate convex decomposition. If not set, then the voxel-based approximate convex decomposition will be used (default).

param.name: intParams
param.description: bit0 set (1): the specified shape will be morphed into its convex decomposition. Otherwise, the convex decomposition will smply be added to the scene

param.name: floatParams
param.description: bit1 set (2): specified convex decomposition parameters will be displayed in a dialog, allowing the user to modify them.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. Otherwise the handle of the new shape, or the handle of the original shape when morphing.

function.name: simCopyPasteObjects
function.description: Copies and pastes objects

param.name: objectHandles
param.description: array containing the handles of the objects to copy and paste. The same array will receive the copied object handles, with the same correspondency.

param.name: objectCount
param.description: the number of handles contained in the objectHandles array.

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded. If bit0 is set (i.e. 1), then whole models will be copied. In that case, all specified objects should be flagged as
model base
. If bit1 is set (i.e. 2), then all simulation and customization scripts are stripped away. If bit2 is set (i.e. 4), then all object custom data properties are stripped away. If bit3 is set (i.e. 8), then all object references are stripped away. If bit4 is set (i.e. 16), then all textures are stripped away. If bit5 is set (i.e. 32), then model tags and DNA information is stripped away.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful.

bit1 is set (i.e. 2): all simulation and customization scripts are stripped away
bit2 is set (i.e. 4): all object custom data properties are stripped away
bit3 is set (i.e. 8): all object references are stripped away
bit4 is set (i.e. 16): all textures are stripped away
bit5 is set (i.e. 32): model tags and DNA information is stripped away

bit0 set (1): path is hidden during simulation
bit1 set (2): path is closed
bit2 set (4): generates an extruded shape

function.name: simCreateProximitySensor
function.description: Creates a proximity sensor

param.name: sensorType
param.description: desired proximity sensor type (e.g. sim.proximitysensor_cone)

param.name: subType
param.description: deprecated. Set to 16

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded options:
bit0 set (1): the sensor will be explicitly handled
bit1 set (2): reserved. Set to 0
bit2 set (4): the detection volume is not shown
bit3 set (8): front faces are not detected
bit4 set (16): back faces are not detected
bit5 set (32): fast detection (i.e. not exact detection)
bit6 set (64): the normal of the detected surface with the detection ray will have to lie below a specified threshold angle
bit8 set (256): smallest distance threshold will be active
bit9 set (512): randomized detection (only with ray-type proximity sensors)

param.name: intParams
param.description: bit0 set (1): the sensor will be explicitly handled

param.name: floatParams
param.description: bit1 set (2): reserved. Set to 0

param.name: reserved
param.description: bit2 set (4): the detection volume is not shown

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the handle of the force sensor

bit5 set (32): fast detection (i.e. not exact detection)
bit6 set (64): the normal of the detected surface with the detection ray will have to lie below a specified threshold angle
bit8 set (256): smallest distance threshold will be active
bit9 set (512): randomized detection (only with ray-type proximity sensors)

param.name: intParams

function.name: simCreateShape
function.description: Creates a mesh shape

param.name: options
param.description:
Bit-coded:
if bit0 is set (1), backfaces are culled
If bit1 is set (2), edges are visible
If bit2 is set (4), adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated
If bit3 is set (8), texture is applied as a decal
If bit4 is set (16), texture is RGBA, otherwise it is RGB
If bit5 is set (32), texture is horizontally flipped
If bit6 is set (64), texture is vertically flipped

param.name: shadingAngle
param.description: if bit0 is set (1), backfaces are culled

param.name: vertices
param.description: If bit1 is set (2), edges are visible

param.name: verticesSize
param.description: If bit2 is set (4), adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated

param.name: indices
param.description: If bit3 is set (8), texture is applied as a decal

param.name: indicesSize
param.description: If bit4 is set (16), texture is RGBA, otherwise it is RGB

param.name: normals
param.description: If bit5 is set (32), texture is horizontally flipped

param.name: textureCoordinates
param.description: If bit6 is set (64), texture is vertically flipped

param.name: texture
param.description: shading angle

param.name: textureResolution
param.description: array of vertices

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the handle of the newly created shape

function.name: simCreateTexture
function.description: Creates a planar shape, that will be textured with a new, or imported texture

param.name: fileName
param.description: filename of the texure to import, or an empty string if you wish to create a new texture.

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): do not interpolate adjacent color patches.
bit1 set (2): apply the texture in decal-mode.
bit2 set (4): repeat the texture along the U direction.
bit3 set (8): repeat the texture along the V direction.

param.name: planeSizes
param.description: set (1): do not interpolate adjacent color patches.

param.name: scalingUV
param.description: set (2): apply the texture in decal-mode.

param.name: xy_g
param.description: set (4): repeat the texture along the U direction.

param.name: fixedResolution
param.description: set (8): repeat the texture along the V direction.

param.name: textureId
param.description: a pointer to 2 values: the dimensions of the planar shape that will be generated. Can be nullptr for default dimensions.

param.name: resolution
param.description: a pointer to 2 values: the desired scaling of the texture, along the U and V directions. Can be nullptr for default scalings.

param.name: reserved
param.description: a pointer to 3 values: the texture x/y shift, and the texture gamma-rotation. Can be nullptr for default shift/rotation values.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error, otherwise the object handle of the created planar shape.

function.name: simCreateVisionSensor
function.description: Creates a vision sensor .

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded options:
bit 0 set (1): the sensor will be explicitly handled
bit 1 set (2): the sensor will be in perspective operation mode
bit 2 set (4): the view frustum will not be shown
bit 3 set (8): reserved. Set to 0
bit 4 set (16): the sensor will be passive (use an external image)
bit 5 set (32): the sensor will use local lights
bit 6 set (64): the sensor will not render any fog
bit 7 set (128): the sensor will use a specific color for default background (i.e. null pixels)

param.name: intParams
param.description: bit 0 set (1): the sensor will be explicitly handled

param.name: floatParams
param.description: bit 1 set (2): the sensor will be in perspective operation mode

param.name: reserved
param.description: bit 2 set (4): the view frustum will not be shown

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the handle of the force sensor

function.name: simExecuteScriptString
function.description:
Executes some code in a specific script (from a plugin , the main client application , or from another script). The target script must be initialized for this call to succeed, e.g. when calling simulation scripts , then simulation must be running
From C/C++, data exchange between a plugin and a script happens via a stack . Reading and writing arguments from/to the stack gives you a maximum of flexibility, and you wil be able to exchange also complex data structures. But it can also be tedious and error prone. Use instead the helper classes located in
programming/include/simStack

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: the handle of the script

param.name: stringToExecute
param.description: a string representing the code to execute in the specified script

param.name: stackId
param.description: 0 (for no stack) or a stack handle . The stack holds possible out values. See also the available stack functions .

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error

function.name: sim.executeScriptString
function.description:
Executes some code in a specific script (from a plugin , the main client application , or from another script). The target script must be initialized for this call to succeed, e.g. when calling simulation scripts , then simulation must be running
From C/C++, data exchange between a plugin and a script happens via a stack . Reading and writing arguments from/to the stack gives you a maximum of flexibility, and you wil be able to exchange also complex data structures. But it can also be tedious and error prone. Use instead the helper classes located in
programming/include/simStack

param.name: stringToExecute
param.description: a string representing the code to execute in the specified script. An optional @python or @lua can be appended, to force a specific language

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: handle of the script, or sim.handle_self to target the script itself.

param.name: result
param.description: 0 or 1

param.name: executionResult
param.description: return value of the executed code

more.code:
--lua
-- Exports all shapes in the scene import('simEigen', '*') local allVertices = {} local allIndices = {} local allShapes = sim.scene:getDescendants({'shape'}) for j = 1, #allShapes do local shape = allShapes[j] local vertices, indices = shape:getMeshData() local p = shape.absPose for i = 1, #vertices // 3, 1 do local v = Vector{vertices[3 * (i - 1) +1], vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 2], vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 3]} v = p * v vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 1] = v[1] vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 2] = v[2] vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 3] = v[3] end table.insert(allVertices, vertices) table.insert(allIndices, indices) end
if #allVertices > 0 then sim.exportMesh(0, "d:\\example.obj", 0, 1, allVertices, allIndices) end

function.name: simGenerateShapeFromPath
function.description: Generates an extrusion shape from a path

param.name: path
param.description: path, specified in row-major order, with [x y z qx qy qz qw] values for each path point. The orientation parts for each path point are ignored if the two first bits of are zero.

param.name: pathSize
param.description: size/length of the path pointer

param.name: section
param.description: extrusion profile, with x/y pairs, e.g. [x1 y1 x2 y2 ... xn yn]. If the first and last pair overlap, the section is closed

param.description: size/length of the section pointer

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0-bit1: 0 = upVector is upVector , 1 = upVector is the x-axis of the path point frame, 2 = upVector is the y-axis of the path point frame, 3 = upVector is the z-axis of the path point frame
bit2 set (4): the path is closed

param.name: upVector
param.description: bit0-bit1: 0 = upVector is , 1 = upVector is the x-axis of the path point frame, 2 = upVector is the y-axis of the path point frame, 3 = upVector is the z-axis of the path point frame

param.name: reserved
param.description: bit2 set (4): the path is closed

param.name: return
param.description: the handle of the generated shape

function.name: simGetApiFunc
function.description: Retrieves all API functions and variables that match a specific word. Useful for script code auto-completion functionality

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: handle of the script . Can be -1 to be script agnostic.

param.name: apiWord
param.description: word that API functions and variables should match, e.g. "sim.getObj". Only matches up to the first dot are returned, if the apiWord does not contain any dot. To retrieve all functions and variables, leave apiWord empty. To retrieve only functions, add '+' as prefix. To retrieve only variables, add '-' as prefix.

param.name: return
param.description: nullptr in case of an error, or if there is no match. Otherwise all matching API functions and variables, space-separated. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

function.name: sim.getApiFunc

param.name: apiWord
param.description: word that API functions and variables should match, e.g. "sim.getObj". Only matches up to the first dot are returned, if the apiWord does not contain any dot. To retrieve all functions and variables, leave apiWord empty. To retrieve only functions, add '+' as prefix. To retrieve only variables, add '-' as prefix.

param.name: funcsAndVars
param.description: array containing all matching API functions and variables.

function.name: simGetApiInfo
function.description: Returns the call tip (or info text) for an API function

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: handle of the script . Can be -1 to be script agnostic

param.name: apiWord
param.description: API functions or variable to retrieve the info for, e.g. "sim.getObject". Return is for the latest version of a module by default. For a specific module version, specify its full name, e.g. "sim-1.getObject". Using the wildcard, e.g. "sim-*.getObject", the returned information is prepended by its related module name (e.g. "[sim-1]"), for all available modules

param.name: return
param.description: nullptr in case of an error. Otherwise the information related to the API function or variable. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

function.name: sim.getApiInfo
function.description: Returns the call tip (or info text) for an API function

param.name: scriptHandle

param.name: apiWord
param.description: API functions or variable to retrieve the info for, e.g. "sim.getObject". Return is for the latest version of a module by default. For a specific module version, specify its full name, e.g. "sim-1.getObject". Using the wildcard, e.g. "sim-*.getObject", the returned information is prepended by its related module name (e.g. "[sim-1]"), for all available modules

param.name: info
param.description: information related to the API function or variable

function.name: simGetCollectionObjects
function.description: Retrieves the object handles that compose a collection

param.name: collectionHandle
param.description: handle of the collection

function.name: sim.getConfigDistance
function.description: Returns the distance between two configurations points

param.name: configA
param.description: the first configuration, e.g. in case of a 3D pose (position+quaternion), would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1]

param.name: configB
param.description: the second configuration

param.name: metric
param.description: an optional array specifying the metric to use to compute distances. e.g. if the specified configurations were 3D positions, the distance between two configurations would be calculated as SQRT( mx * (x2 - x1)^2 + my * (y2 - y1)^2 + mz * (z2 - z1)^2 ), where [mx my mz] would be the metric.

param.name: types
param.description: an optional array specifying the type of each configuration value/dimension: 0=cartesian value, 1=2pi-cyclic value, 2=quaternion value. e.g. a configuration representing 3D poses should use a types argument [0 0 0 2 2 2 2], a configuration representing revolute and cyclic joints should use a types argument [1 1 1 ...]

param.name: distance
param.description: the distance between the two configurations

function.name: simGetContactInfo
function.description: Retrieves contact point information of a dynamic simulation pass.

param.name: dynamicPass
param.description: specific dynamic sub-step index or sim.handle_all. By default a call to simHandleDynamics executes the dynamics engine x times, with x times smaller time steps (where x is a parameter that can be adjusted). At each of those sub-steps, contacts are created and destroyed. With the dynamicPass argument you can select which sub-step you wish to retrieve contacts from (zero-based index), or sim.handle_all to retrieve the contacts of all sub-steps. See also the dynamicsStepSize property.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a specific object you wish to retrieve contacts from, or sim.handle_all to retrieve all contacts in the scene.

param.name: index
param.description: zero-based index of the contact to retrieve. Optionally, you may add sim.handleflag_extended to the index, if you also wish to retrieve the normal vector (see further down)

param.name: objectHandles
param.description: handles of the two objects contacting. The handles might also refer to particle objects that are not treated as regular scene objects.

param.name: contactInfo
param.description: pointer to 6 values (or 9 values if sim.handleflag_extended was added to index), where the 3 first values represent the contact position, the 3 next values represent the force generated by the contact, and the (optional) 3 last values represent the normal vector at the contact. The force vector returned by the Bullet engine will omit the component that results from fricition.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error, 0 if no contact was found at the given index or 1 if a contact was returned.

function.name: sim.getContactInfo
function.description: Retrieves contact point information of a dynamic simulation pass.

param.name: dynamicPass
param.description: a specific dynamic sub-step index or sim.handle_all. By default a call to simHandleDynamics executes the dynamics engine x times, with x times smaller time steps (where x is a parameter that can be adjusted). At each of those sub-steps, contacts are created and destroyed. With the dynamicPass argument you can select which sub-step you wish to retrieve contacts from (zero-based index), or sim.handle_all to retrieve the contacts of all sub-steps. See also the dynamicsStepSize property.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a specific object you wish to retrieve contacts from, or sim.handle_all to retrieve all contacts in the scene.

param.name: index
param.description: zero-based index of the contact to retrieve

param.name: coll
param.description: handles of the two objects contacting. The handles might also refer to particle objects that are not treated as regular scene objects

param.name: point
param.description: coordinates of the contact

param.name: rForce
param.description: vector that represents the force generated by the contact

param.name: n
param.description: normal vector at the contact point

function.name: simGetExtensionString
function.description: Retrieves a string that describes additional environment or object properties, mainly used by extension plugins.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: the handle of an object, or -1 if you wish to retrieve the extension string of the environment.

param.name: index
param.description: keep to -1, unless the object is a shape, and you wish to retrieve the extension string of a shape component (since a shape can be a compound of several other shapes).

param.name: key
param.description:
an optional key indicating what value to retrieve. If none is specified, then the whole extension string will be returned. Keys should have the form of
key@parentKey@...@parentKey
. To retrieve the
shadow enabled
value of extension string "povray{ shadow {true} fadeXDist {0.00}}", specify following key:
shadow@povray
. The key is case sensitive.

param.name: return
param.description: a string if the operation was successful. The user is in charge of releasing the buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

param.name: key

optional key indicating what value to retrieve. If None/nil is specified, then the whole extension string is returned. Keys should have the form of
key@parentKey@...@parentKey
. To retrieve the
shadow enabled
value of extension string "povray{ shadow {true} fadeXDist {0.00}}", specify following key:
shadow@povray
. The key is case sensitive.

param.name: theString

function.name: simGetJointForce
function.description: Retrieves the force or torque applied to a joint along/about its active axis. This function retrieves meaningful information only if the joint is prismatic or revolute, and is dynamically enabled. With the Bullet, MuJoCo and Newton engine, this function returns the force or torque applied to the joint motor (torques from joint limits are not taken into account). With the ODE and Vortex engine, this function returns the total force or torque applied to a joint along/about its z-axis

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: handle of the joint. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_rawvalue (simply add sim.handleflag_rawvalue to jointHandle), if you wish to access the raw values generated by each individual dynamic simulation step (by default, there are 10 dynamic simulation steps for each simulation step). Raw values can only be accessed from inside a callback function triggered by the physics engine.

param.name: forceOrTorque
param.description: the force or the torque applied to the joint along/about its z-axis.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. 0 if no value is available yet (e.g. when simHandleDynamics hasn't yet handled that joint), otherwise a value >0.

function.name: sim.getJointForce
function.description: Retrieves the force or torque applied to a joint along/about its active axis. This function retrieves meaningful information only if the joint is prismatic or revolute, and is dynamically enabled. With the Bullet, MuJoCo and Newton engine, this function returns the force or torque applied to the joint motor (torques from joint limits are not taken into account). With the ODE and Vortex engine, this function returns the total force or torque applied to a joint along/about its z-axis

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: handle of the joint. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_rawvalue (simply add sim.handleflag_rawvalue to jointHandle), if you wish to access the raw values generated by each individual dynamic simulation step (by default, there are 10 dynamic simulation steps for each simulation step). Raw values can only be accessed from inside a callback function triggered by the physics engine.

param.name: forceOrTorque
param.description: force or the torque applied to the joint along/about its z-axis.

param.name: handle

function.name: simGetObjectAlias
function.description: Retrieves the alias or path of an object based on its handle

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object.

param.name: options
param.description:
alias formating options:
-1: naked alias (e.g. "alias")
0: ordered alias (e.g. "alias[0]")
1: short path that fully identifies the object (e.g. "/parent/alias[0]")
2: full path (e.g. "/parentA/parentB/alias[0]")
3: naked alias with handle, if the alias is not unique (e.g. "alias" or "alias__42__")
4: naked alias with handle (e.g. "alias__42__")
5: print version of the short path, not guaranteed to be unique (e.g. "/parent/ ... /alias")
6: path using just the alias and an index number (e.g. "/alias{3}")
7: same as 6, but using the first parent model, if present (e.g. "/parentModel{2}/alias{3}")
8: same as 6, but using the first 2 parent models, if present (e.g. "/parentModelA{4}/parentModelB{2}/alias{3}")
9: same as 6, but using all parent models, if present (e.g. "/parentModelA{4}/.../parentModelN{2}/alias{3}")

param.name: return
param.description: Alias or path of the object if operation was successful, nullptr otherwise. The user is in charge of destroying the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer

function.name: sim.getObjectAlias
function.description: Retrieves the alias or path of an object based on its handle

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object.

param.name: options
param.description:
alias formating options:
-1: naked alias (e.g. "alias")
0: ordered alias (e.g. "alias[0]")
1: short path that fully identifies the object (e.g. "/parent/alias[0]")
2: full path (e.g. "/parentA/parentB/alias[0]")
3: naked alias with handle, if the alias is not unique (e.g. "alias" or "alias__42__")
4: naked alias with handle (e.g. "alias__42__")
5: print version of the short path, not guaranteed to be unique (e.g. "/parent/ ... /alias")
6: path using just the alias and an index number (e.g. "/alias{3}")
7: same as 6, but using the first parent model, if present (e.g. "/parentModel{2}/alias{3}")
8: same as 6, but using the first 2 parent models, if present (e.g. "/parentModelA{4}/parentModelB{2}/alias{3}")
9: same as 6, but using all parent models, if present (e.g. "/parentModelA{4}/.../parentModelN{2}/alias{3}")

param.name: alias
param.description: alias or path of the object

function.name: simGetObjectMatrix
function.description: Retrieves the transformation matrix of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe (see next argument)

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame we want the matrix. Specify sim.handle_world to retrieve the absolute transformation matrix, sim.handle_inverse to retrieve the inverse of the absolute transformation matrix, sim.handle_parent to retrieve the transformation matrix relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame we want the transformation matrix. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the matrix relative to the joint's moving frame will be returned (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the matrix relative to the joint's base frame will be returned).

param.name: matrix
param.description: pointer to 12 double values

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simGetObjectOrientation

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe (see next argument)

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame we want the orientation. Specify sim.handle_world to retrieve the absolute orientation, sim.handle_inverse to retrieve the inverse of the absolute orientation, sim.handle_parent to retrieve the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the orientation. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the orientation relative to the joint's moving frame will be returned (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the orientation relative to the joint's base frame will be returned).

param.name: eulerAngles
param.description: Euler angles (alpha, beta and gamma)

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simGetObjectVelocity
function.description: Retrieves the linear and/or angular velocity of an object, in absolute coordinates. The velocity is a measured velocity (i.e. from one simulation step to the next), and is available for all objects in the scene

param.name: objectHandle
param.description:
handle of a scene object . It is highly recommended to add
sim.handleflag_axis
to the object handle, in order to obtain the
regular
angular velocity for the object, i.e. the rotation axis and the rotation velocity that is represented by the axis' length. If
sim.handleflag_axis
is omitted, then a derivative of Euler angles expressed relative to previous' simulation frame will be returned for the angular velocity

param.name: linearVelocity
param.description: pointer to 3 values that will receive the linear velocity. Can be nullptr

param.name: angularVelocity
param.description: pointer to 3 values that will receive the angular velocity. Can be nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: sim.getObjectVelocity
function.description: Retrieves the linear and/or angular velocity of an object, in absolute coordinates. The velocity is a measured velocity (i.e. from one simulation step to the next), and is available for all objects in the scene

param.name: objectHandle
param.description:
handle of a scene object . It is highly recommended to add
sim.handleflag_axis
to the object handle, in order to obtain the
regular
angular velocity for the object, i.e. the rotation axis and the rotation velocity that is represented by the axis' length. If
sim.handleflag_axis
is omitted, then a derivative of Euler angles expressed relative to previous' simulation frame will be returned for the angular velocity

param.name: linearVelocity
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the linear velocity

param.name: angularVelocity
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the angular velocity

function.name: sim.getPathInterpolatedConfig
function.description: Returns an interpolated configuration from a path

param.name: path
param.description: the path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D poses (position+quaternion) would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1 x2 y2 z2 qx2 qy2 qz2 qw2]

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: the lengths of a path. Each path point should have a corresponding length value (as the distance from the path's first point, along the path). See also sim.getPathLengths .

param.name: t
param.description: the distance from the beginning of the path, where the interpolation point should be picked from

param.name: method
param.description: an optional map specifying the type of interpolation (linear or quadraticBezier), whether the path should be considered as open, even if the first and last path points overlap, and the bezier strength (0.05-1.0)

param.name: types
param.description: an optional array specifying the type of each configuration value/dimension: 0=cartesian value, 1=2pi-cyclic value, 2=quaternion value. e.g. a configuration representing 3D poses should use a types argument [0 0 0 2 2 2 2], a configuration representing revolute and cyclic joints should use a types argument [1 1 1 ...]

param.name: config
param.description: the interpolated path configuration

function.name: sim.getPathLengths
function.description: Returns the lengths of a path in 1, 2 or 3D Cartesian space, even if more coordinates are provided. Each path point will have a corresponding length value (taken as the distance from the path's first point, along the path)

param.name: path
param.description: the path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D poses (position+quaternion) would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1 x2 y2 z2 qx2 qy2 qz2 qw2]

param.name: dof
param.description: the size or dimension of path points, e.g. in case of a 3D pose, this would be 7 (however only the first 3 dimensions would be taken into account)

param.name: distCallback
param.description: an optional function that takes as input two configurations, and returns the calculated distance between them. See also sim.getConfigDistance

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: the lengths corresponding to each path point

param.name: totalLength
param.description: the total length of the path

function.name: simGetPointCloudOptions
function.description: Gets various properties of a point cloud

param.name: pointCloudHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: maxVoxelSize
param.description: maximum size of the OC tree voxels containing points

param.name: maxPtCntPerVoxel
param.description: maximum number of points allowed in a same OC tree voxel

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): points have random colors
bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep unset
bit3 set (8): do not use an OC tree structure. When enabled, point cloud operations are limited, and point clouds will not be collidable , measurable or detectable anymore, but adding points will be much faster
bit4 set (16): color is emissive

param.name: pointSize
param.description: bit0 set (1): points have random colors

param.name: reserved
param.description: bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure

param.name: return
param.description: 1 if operation was successful

param.name: opt
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): points have random colors
bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep unset
bit3 set (8): do not use an OC tree structure. When enabled, point cloud operations are limited, and point clouds will not be collidable , measurable or detectable anymore, but adding points will be much faster
bit4 set (16): color is emissive

param.name: ps
param.description: bit0 set (1): points have random colors

function.name: simGetScaledImage
function.description: Generates a scaled-up or scaled down version of the input image

param.name: imageIn
param.description: pointer to rgb or rgba values of the input image.

param.name: resolutionIn
param.description: resolution of the input image.

param.name: resolutionOut
param.description: desired resolution of the output image. The values will be replaced by the effective resolution of the output image

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the input image is rgba, otherwise it is rgb
bit1 set (2): the returned image is rgba, otherwise it is rgb
bit2-3: 0:ignore aspect ratio, 4:keep aspect ratio (the effective resolution of the returned image will be different), 8:keep aspect ratio by expanding (the effective resolution of the returned image will be different)
bit4 set (16): no smooth transformation

param.name: reserved
param.description: bit0 set (1): the input image is rgba, otherwise it is rgb

param.name: return
param.description: nullptr if operation was not successful, otherwise a buffer containing the output image data. The user is in charge of releasing the buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

function.name: sim.getScaledImage
function.description: Generates a scaled-up or scaled down version of the input image

param.name: imageIn
param.description: image buffer (rgb or rgba values)

param.name: resolutionIn
param.description: resolution of the input image

param.name: desiredResolutionOut
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the input image is rgba, otherwise it is rgb
bit1 set (2): the returned image is rgba, otherwise it is rgb
bit2-3: 0:ignore aspect ratio, 4:keep aspect ratio (the effective resolution of the returned image will be different), 8:keep aspect ratio by expanding (the effective resolution of the returned image will be different)
bit4 set (16): no smooth transformation

param.name: options
param.description: bit0 set (1): the input image is rgba, otherwise it is rgb

param.name: imageOut
param.description: buffer containing the output image data

param.name: effectiveResolutionOut
param.description: resolution of the generated image

function.name: simGetShapeGeomInfo
function.description: Retrieves geometric information related to a shape

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: intData
param.description: pointer to 5 integer values:

param.name: floatData
param.description: intData[0]: the primitive type of the shape. Undefined if the shape is a compound shape.

param.name: reserved
param.description:
pointer to 5 double values:
floatData[0]: X-size or diameter of the primitive shape. Undefined if the shape is a compound shape or not primitive.
floatData[1]: Y-size of the primitive shape. Undefined if the shape is a compound shape or not primitive.
floatData[2]: Z-size or height of the primitive shape. Undefined if the shape is a compound shape or not primitive.
floatData[3]: Reserved.

param.name: return
param.description:
-1 in case of an error, otherwise bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): shape is a compound shape
bit1 set (2): shape is primitive
bit2 set (4): shape is convex

param.description: handle of the shape object

param.name: inertiaMatrix
param.description: (output): inertia matrix (9 values), expressed relative to the shape's reference frame orientation. The matrix is symmetric

param.name: com
param.description: (output): a transformation matrix [0 0 0 P0 0 0 0 P1 0 0 0 P2] indicating the center of mass, expressed relative to the shape's reference frame. The matrix does not contain any rotational part (only the positional values are relevant).

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error

function.name: simGetShapeViz
function.description: Retrieves a shape's visual information.

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape. Can be combined with sim_handleflag_extended in order to retrieve extended data

param.name: index
param.description: 0-based index of the shape element to retrieve (compound shapes contain more than one shape element)

param.name: info
param.description:
visual information about the shape:
vertices : array of vertices, relative to the shape's reference frame. The user is in charge of releasing this buffer with simReleaseBuffer if the return value is > 0.
verticesSize : the size of the vertices array
indices : array of indices. The user is in charge of releasing this buffer with simReleaseBuffer if the return value is > 0.
indicesSize : the size of the indices array
normals : array of normals, relative to the shape's reference frame. There are 3*indicesSize normals, i.e. 3 normals per triangle. The user is in charge of releasing this buffer with simReleaseBuffer if the return value is > 0.
shadingAngle : the gouraud shading angle
colors[9] : array of colors: RGB for ambient-diffuse, specular, and emission.
transparency : transparency value (0.0 = opaque, 1.0 = fully transparent). To have this field written, combine shapeHandle with sim_handleflag_extended
options : bit-coded options (to have this field written, combine shapeHandle with sim_handleflag_extended):
bit0 set (1): backfaces are culled
texture : the RGBA texture (32bit/pixel). The user is in charge of releasing this buffer with simReleaseBuffer if the return value is > 1.
textureId : a texture id (to identify textures shared among several shapes)
textureRes[2] : the resolution of the texture
textureCoords : the texture coordinates. There are 3*indicesSize texture coordinates, i.e. 3 coordinates per triangle. The user is in charge of releasing this buffer with simReleaseBuffer if the return value is > 1.
textureApplyMode : 0=modulate, 1=decal, 2=add
textureOptions : bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): repeat U
bit1 set (2): repeat V
bit2 set (4): interpolate colors
bit3 set (8): wireframe

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, 0 if there is no shape element at the given indexm, 1 if the shape element does not contain any texture, 2 if the shape element contains a texture

param.name: data

function.name: simGetSimulatorMessage
function.description: Retrieves and removes the next message in the C/C++ or Lua message queues. Use this in a while-loop until all messages have been extracted. While the C/C++ interface has one single message queue, each Lua script has its own message queue. The C/C++ version of this function should only be called from the CoppeliaSim client application. A given message queue cannot hold more than 64 messages, unread messages will be discarded.

param.name: messageID
auxiliaryData
param.description: array of 4 integers that can describe the returned message in more details

param.name: returnedDataSize
param.description: size of the returned buffer

param.name: return
param.description: nullptr if no buffer was returned, otherwise a buffer that should be released with simReleaseBuffer

function.name: sim.getSimulatorMessage
function.description: Retrieves and removes the next message in the C/C++ or Lua message queues. Use this in a while-loop until all messages have been extracted. While the C/C++ interface has one single message queue, each Lua script has its own message queue. The C/C++ version of this function should only be called from the CoppeliaSim client application. A given message queue cannot hold more than 64 messages, unread messages will be discarded.

param.name: auxiliaryData
param.description: array of numbers that describe the returned message in more details

param.name: auxiliaryData2
param.description: array of numbers that describe the returned message in more details

function.name: simGetStackDoubleTable
function.description: Retrieves a double-precision double array from an array-type table at the top of the stack. Table values that are not numbers are converted to 0.0

param.description: a pointer to a location receiving the double values. Use simGetStackTableInfo to determine the number of values the table contains.

param.description: the size of the array. If the array is bigger than the table, it will be padded with 0.0.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error, 0 if item is not an array or does not contain only numbers, 1 otherwise.

stringSize

rows
/
cols
are set to -1. If the stack item is not a matrix, the return value is nullptr and
rows
/
cols
are set to 0. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer )

function.name: simGetStackTableInfo
function.description: Tries to retrieve information about a possible table at the top of the stack

param.name: stackHandle
param.description: stack handle obtained with simCreateStack .

param.name: infoType
param.description:
type of information desired:
0 : whether we have a table, whether the table is an array-type or map-type, and the size of the array-type table
1 : whether the table contains only null values
2 : whether the table contains only number values
3 : whether the table contains only bool values
4 : whether the table contains only string values
5 : whether the table contains only table values
6 : whether the table contains only matrices

param.name: return
param.description:
-1 in case of an error, otherwise one of following:
if infoType is 0: a stack table information value . If the returned value is >0, then this means the table is an array-type table, containing value-key pairs, where all the keys are numbers, consecutive, and starting at 1. Use simUnfoldStackTable to read the content of the table
if infoType is 1: 1 if the table contains only null values
if infoType is 2: 1 if the table contains only number values
if infoType is 3: 1 if the table contains only bool values
if infoType is 4: 1 if the table contains only string values
if infoType is 5: 1 if the table contains only table values
if infoType is 6: 1 if the table contains only matrices
