function.name: simGetVisionSensorDepth
function.description: Reads the depth buffer of a vision sensor. The returned data doesn't make sense if sim.handleVisionSensor wasn't called previously

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the returned values indicate distances in meters, otherwise return values are in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 (0.0 = closest to sensor (i.e. close clipping plane), 1.0 = farthest from sensor (i.e. far clipping plane))

param.name: pos
param.description: bit0 set (1): the returned values indicate distances in meters, otherwise return values are in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 (0.0 = closest to sensor (i.e. close clipping plane), 1.0 = farthest from sensor (i.e. far clipping plane))

param.name: size
param.description: position of the depth buffer portion to retrieve. Can be nullptr, which defaults to [0 0]

param.name: resolution
param.description: size of the depth buffer portion to retrieve. Can be nullptr, which defaults to [0 0], which corresponds to [resolutionX resolutionY]

param.name: return
param.description: the depth buffer or nullptr in case of an error. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer

function.name: sim.getVisionSensorDepth
function.description: Reads the depth buffer of a vision sensor. The returned data doesn't make sense if sim.handleVisionSensor wasn't called previously

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the returned values indicate distances in meters, otherwise return values are in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 (0.0 = closest to sensor (i.e. close clipping plane), 1.0 = farthest from sensor (i.e. far clipping plane))

param.name: pos
param.description: bit0 set (1): the returned values indicate distances in meters, otherwise return values are in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 (0.0 = closest to sensor (i.e. close clipping plane), 1.0 = farthest from sensor (i.e. far clipping plane))

param.name: size
param.description: position of the depth buffer portion to retrieve. Defaults to [0 0]

param.name: depth
param.description: the depth buffer. Use sim.unpackFloatTable to obtain an array of values

param.name: resolution
param.description: the vision sensor resolution

function.name: simGetVisionSensorImg
function.description: Reads the image of a vision sensor. The returned data doesn't make sense if sim.handleVisionSensor wasn't called previously

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the returned image will by a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image
bit1 set (2): the returned image will have one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: rgbaCutOff
param.description: bit0 set (1): the returned image will by a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image

param.name: pos
param.description: bit1 set (2): the returned image will have one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: size
param.description:
when an RGBA image is returned, the alpha component will be 255 for all depth values below
rgbaCutOff
, and 0 for all depth values above
rgbaCutOff
. 0 corresponds to the near clipping plane, 1 to the far clipping plane

param.name: resolution
param.description: position of the image portion to retrieve. Can be nullptr, which defaults to [0 0]

param.name: return
param.description: the image buffer or nullptr in case of an error. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer

options, bit-coded:

param.name: rgbaCutOff
param.description: bit0 set (1): the returned image will by a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image

param.name: pos
param.description: bit1 set (2): the returned image will have one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: size
param.description:
when an RGBA image is returned, the alpha component is 255 for all depth values below
rgbaCutOff
, and 0 for all depth values above
rgbaCutOff
. 0.0 corresponds to the near clipping plane, 1.0 to the far clipping plane

param.description: time where next value will be recorded at, usually the simulation time

function.name: simHandleProximitySensor
function.description: Handles (performs sensing, etc. of) a registered proximity sensor object

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of a proximity sensor object or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit. (sim.handle_all will handle all proximity sensor objects, while sim.handle_all_except_explicit will only handle those that are not marked as "explicit handling")

param.name: detectedPoint
param.description: coordinates of the closest detected point (x, y and z: detectedPoint[0]-detectedPoint[2]) relative to the sensor reference frame, and distance to the detected point (1 value: detectedPoint[3]). Can be nullptr

param.name: detectedObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that was detected. Can be nullptr

param.name: detectedSurfaceNormalVector
param.description: normal vector (normalized) of the detected surface. Relative to the sensor reference frame. Can be nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: 0 if nothing was detected, -1 in case of an error.

function.name: sim.handleProximitySensor
function.description: Handles (performs sensing, etc. of) a registered proximity sensor object

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of a proximity sensor object, or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit

param.name: res
param.description: 0 if nothing was detected

param.name: dist
param.description: distance to the detected point

param.name: point
param.description: array of 3 numbers indicating the relative coordinates of the detected point

param.name: obj
param.description: handle of the object that was detected

param.name: n
param.description: array of normal vector (normalized) of the detected surface. Relative to the sensor reference frame

function.name: sim.handleSandboxScript
function.description: Calls a specific function in the sandbox . sim.handleSandboxScript should only be called from the main script

param.name: callType

function.name: sim.handleSensingStart
function.description:
Handles various functionality (e.g. camera tracking during simulation, object velocity calculation, etc.). Should only be called from the main script , as the first instruction in the
sensing
section

function.name: sim.handleSimulationStart
function.description:
Initializes various functionality (e.g. camera tracking during simulation, object velocity calculation, etc.). Should only be called from the main script , as the first instruction in the
initialization
section

function.name: simHandleVisionSensor
function.description: Handles (performs sensing, etc. of) a vision sensor object. It (1) clear previous computed image processing data, (2) reads an image and (3) performs image processing via the vision callback functions (if the vision sensor is using an external input only (1) is performed)

param.name: visionSensorHandle
param.description: handle of a vision sensor object or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit. (sim.handle_all will handle all vision sensor objects, while sim.handle_all_except_explicit will only handle those that are not marked as "explicit handling")

param.name: auxValues
param.description: by default CoppeliaSim returns one packet of 15 auxiliary values: the minimum of [intensity red green blue depth], the maximum of [intensity red green blue depth], and the average of [intensity red green blue depth]. If the vision callback function returns additional values, then they are appended as packets to the first packet. AuxValues can be nullptr. The user is in charge of releasing the auxValues buffer with simReleaseBuffer (*auxValues). If visionSensorHandle is sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit, nothing is returned in auxValues.

param.name: auxValuesCount
param.description: contains information about the number of auxiliary value packets and packet sizes returned in auxValues. The first value is the number of packets, the second is the size of packet1, the third is the size of packet2, etc. Can be nullptr if auxValues is also nullptr. The user is in charge of releasing the auxValuesCount buffer with simReleaseBuffer (*auxValuesCount).

param.name: return
param.description: number of detections (number of vision sensors that triggered a detection), -1 in case of an error

function.name: sim.handleVisionSensor
function.description: Handles (performs sensing, etc. of) a vision sensor object. It (1) clear previous computed image processing data, (2) reads an image and (3) performs image processing via the vision callback functions (if the vision sensor is using an external input only (1) is performed)

param.name: visionSensorHandle
param.description: handle of a vision sensor object or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit

param.name: detectionCount
param.description: number of detections (number of vision sensors that triggered a detection)

param.name: packet1
param.description: default auxiliary value packet (15 auxiliary values: the minimum of [intensity red green blue depth], the maximum of [intensity red green blue depth], and the average of [intensity red green blue depth])

param.name: packet2
param.description: additional auxiliary value packet (e.g. from an image processing component)

function.name: simImportMesh
function.description: Imports a mesh from a file

param.name: fileformat
param.description: set to 0. Fileformat is automatically detected

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: the location of the file to import.

param.name: options
param.description: bit-coded: bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices, bit7 set (128): ignore up-vector coded in fileformat

param.name: identicalVerticeTolerance
param.description: has no effect. set to zero

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: the scaling factor to apply to the imported vertices

param.name: vertices
param.description: an array to vertice arrays. The import operation may generate several meshes depending on the fileformat. The user is in charge of releasing the memory. See the example below

param.name: verticesSizes
param.description: an array indicating the individual vertice array sizes. The user is in charge of releasing the memory. See the example below

param.name: indices
param.description: an array to indice arrays. The import operation may generate several meshes depending on the fileformat. The user is in charge of releasing the memory. Can be nullptr. See the example below

param.name: indicesSizes
param.description: an array indicating the individual indice array sizes. The user is in charge of releasing the memory. Can be nullptr if indices is also nullptr. See the example below

param.name: reserved
param.description: reserved for future extensions. Keep at nullptr.

param.name: names
param.description: not used anymore. Set to nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: Number of imported meshes, or 0 or -1 if the operation was not successful

function.name: sim.importMesh
function.description: Imports a mesh from a file

param.name: fileformat
param.description: set to 0. Fileformat is automatically detected

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: the location of the file to import.

param.name: options
param.description: bit-coded: bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices, bit7 set (128): ignore up-vector coded in fileformat

param.name: identicalVerticeTolerance
param.description: has no effect. set to zero

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: the scaling factor to apply to the imported vertices

param.name: vertices
param.description: an array of vertice arrays. The import operation may generate several meshes depending on the fileformat

param.name: indices
param.description: an array of index arrays. The import operation may generate several meshes depending on the fileformat

more.code:
--lua
local vertices, indices, reserved, names = sim.importMesh(1, "d:\\example.dxf", 0, 0.0001, 1) for i = 1, #vertices, 1 do h = sim.createShape(2, 20 * math.pi / 180, vertices[i], indices[i]) sim.setShapeColor(h, "", sim.colorcomponent_ambient, {0.5, 0.5, 0.5}) sim.setObjectAlias(h, names[i]) end

function.name: simImportShape
function.description: Imports a shape from a file (first imports meshes, then groups/merges them into a shape)

param.name: fileformat
param.description: set to 0. Fileformat is automatically detected

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: the location of the file to import.

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices
bit1 set (2): reserced. keep at 0.
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep at 0.
bit3 set (8): do not preserve colors
bit4 set (16): tries to preserve textures.
bit5 set (32): realigns the shape's bounding box with the world.
bit7 set (128): ignore up-vector coded in fileformat.

param.name: identicalVerticeTolerance
param.description: bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: bit1 set (2): reserced. keep at 0.

param.name: return
param.description: The handle of the imported shape, or -1 if the operation was not successful

function.name: sim.importShape

param.name: fileformat
param.description: set to 0. Fileformat is automatically detected

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: the location of the file to import.

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices
bit1 set (2): reserced. keep at 0.
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep at 0.
bit3 set (8): do not preserve colors
bit4 set (16): tries to preserve textures.
bit5 set (32): realigns the shape's bounding box with the world.
bit7 set (128): ignore up-vector coded in fileformat.

param.name: identicalVerticeTolerance
param.description: bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: bit1 set (2): reserced. keep at 0.

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: the handle of the imported shape

function.name: simInsertDataIntoStackTable
function.description:
Inserts data into a table on the stack. The function expects a
value
at the top of the stack, a
key
one position below, and a table below that. The value and its associated key will be inserted into the table and removed from the stack. If successive values are inserted with consecutive number keys starting at 1, then the table values can be accessed via number indices in a script, and the table can be seen as an array. Otherwise, the table can be seen as a map or associative array

param.name: stackHandle
param.description: a stack handle obtained with simCreateStack .

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error.

function.name: simInsertObjectIntoOctree
function.description: Inserts an object into an OC tree , as voxels. Each voxel will store a color and a tag value

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object to insert. Only potentially collidable objects are supported

param.name: options
param.description: reserved. Set to 0

param.name: color
param.description: pointer to one RGB triple, specifying the red, green and blue color components (0-255). Can be nullptr.

param.name: tag
param.description: uint32 value, which is user-defined.

param.name: reserved
param.description: reserved for future extensions. Set to nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the total number of voxels in the OC tree

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree

param.description: handle of the object to insert. Only potentially collidable objects are supported

param.name: options
param.description: reserved. Set to 0

param.name: color
param.description: array of RGB triplet, specifying the red, green and blue color components (0 - 255). Can be None/nil

param.name: tag
param.description: uint32 value, which is user-defined

param.name: totalVoxelCnt

function.name: simInsertObjectIntoPointCloud
function.description: Inserts an object into a point cloud , as points

param.name: pointCloudHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object to insert. Only potentially collidable objects are supported

param.name: options
param.description: reserved. Set to 0

param.name: gridSize
param.description: when a shape is inserted, it will first be converted to an OC tree with a given grid or voxel size.

param.name: color
param.description: pointer to one RGB triple, specifying the red, green and blue color components (0-255). Can be nullptr.

param.name: optionalValues
param.description:
can be used to specify additional parameters, or set to nullptr for default parameter values:
((int*)optionalValues)[0]: integer value that is bit coded. Each bit indicates which additional parameter will be taken into account:
((float*)optionalValues)[1]: duplicateTolerance : a minimum distance tolerance value that is used to avoid duplicate points. To have this parameter taken into account, set bit0 to 1 in ((int*)optionalValues)[0]. Point insertion is slower when the duplicate tolerance is > then 0.0

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the total number of points in the point cloud

function.name: sim.insertObjectIntoPointCloud
function.description: Inserts an object into a point cloud , as points

param.name: pointCloudHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object to insert. Only potentially collidable objects are supported

param.name: options
param.description: reserved. Set to 0

param.name: gridSize
param.description: when a shape is inserted, it will first be converted to an OC tree with a given grid or voxel size

param.name: color
param.description: array containing an RGB triplet, specifying the red, green and blue color components (0 - 255). Can be None/nil.

param.name: duplicateTolerance
param.description: a minimum distance tolerance value that is used to avoid duplicate points

param.name: totalPointCnt
param.description: the total number of points in the point cloud

function.name: simInsertPointsIntoPointCloud
function.description: Inserts points into a point cloud

param.name: pointCloudHandle
param.description: the handle of the point cloud

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame
bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point. Otherwise it contains a single RGB triple

param.name: pts
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: ptCnt
param.description: bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point. Otherwise it contains a single RGB triple

param.name: color
param.description: a pointer to the point positions specified as x/y/z coordinates

param.name: optionalValues
param.description: the number of point coordinates contained in pts

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the total number of points in the point cloud

param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame
bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point. Otherwise it contains a single RGB triple

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: color
param.description: bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point. Otherwise it contains a single RGB triple

param.name: duplicateTolerance

param.description: the total number of points in the point cloud

function.name: simIsHandle

function.name: simModuleEntry
function.description: Creates, modifies or destroys module menu entries. Those are user selectable items located in [Menu bar > Modules]. When selected, the corresponding script will have its sysCall_moduleEntry callback function triggered, or sim_message_eventcallback_moduleentry triggered

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of a module menu entry, or -1 to create one.

param.name: label
param.description:
label of the module entry. If handle is -1, then a path can be specified, in order to build sub-menus, e.g. "Menu
Submenu1
Submenu2
Label". Can be nullptr if handle is not -1.

param.name: state
param.description:
Bit-coded (is ignored if set to -1, -2 destroys an existing item):
bit0 is set (1): the item is enabled
bit1 is set (2): the item is checked
bit2 is set (4): the item is checkable

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the handle of the module menu entry.

function.name: sim.moduleEntry
function.description: Creates, modifies or destroys module menu entries. Those are user selectable items located in [Menu bar > Modules]. When selected, the corresponding script will have its sysCall_moduleEntry callback function triggered, or sim_message_eventcallback_moduleentry triggered

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of a module menu entry, or -1 to create one.

param.name: label
param.description:
label of the module entry. If handle is -1, then a path can be specified, in order to build sub-menus, e.g. "Menu
Submenu1
Submenu2
Label". Can be nullptr if handle is not -1.

param.name: state
param.description:
Bit-coded (is ignored if set to -1, -2 destroys an existing item):
bit0 is set (1): the item is enabled
bit1 is set (2): the item is checked
bit2 is set (4): the item is checkable

param.name: handle
param.description: the handle of the module menu entry

function.name: simMoveStackItemToTop
function.description: Moves a stack into to the top of the stack

param.name: stackHandle
param.description: a stack handle obtained with simCreateStack .

param.name: cIndex
param.description: the zero-based index of the item to move. Negative values indicate reverse counting from the top of the stack (i.e. -1 indicates the stack top)

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error.

function.name: sim.moveToConfig
function.description: Executes a n-DoF motion using the Ruckig online trajectory generator . This function can only be called from scripts running in a thread, since this is a blocking operation

param.name: params
param.description:
parameters of the function:
pos : mandatory if joints is not specified. Specifies the current configuration as a vector with one value per DoF
joints : mandatory if pos is not specified. Specifies the joint handles as a vector with one handle per DoF
targetPos : specifies the target configuration as a vector with one value per DoF
flags : optional. Ruckig flags , -1 for default flags.
vel : optional. Specifies current velocity as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
accel : optional. Specifies current acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
maxVel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minVel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxVel if omitted
maxAccel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minAccel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxAccel if omitted
maxJerk : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed jerk as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
targetVel : optional. Specifies the target velocity as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
callback : optional. Callback function called for each motion step. The argument provided to the callback function is the current motion state
auxData : optional. Data to be forwarded to the callback function
cyclicJoints : optional. Indicates which joint is cyclic (for cyclic joints, the movement always goes in the direction that represents the shortest distance to the goal). Defaults to [false, false, ...] is omitted
timeStep : optional. The desired time step size. A value of 0 indicates that the current simulation time step is used. Defaults to 0 if omitted

param.name: data
param.description: current motion state

param.description:

maxAccel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minAccel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxAccel if omitted
maxJerk : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed jerk as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted

function.name: sim.moveToPose
function.description: Executes an object motion using the Ruckig online trajectory generator , by performing interpolations between two poses. The function can operate by handling 4 motion variables (x,y,z and angle between the two poses), or a single movement variable (t, which requires a metric to be specified for distance calculation between the two poses). This function can only be called from a script running in a thread, since this is a blocking operation

param.name: params
param.description:
parameters of the function:
pose : mandatory if neither object nor ik are specified. Specifies current pose
object : mandatory if neither pose nor ik are specified. Specifies the handle of the object to move
ik : mandatory if neither pose nor object are specified. Contains IK-relevant informations, if a kinematic chain should move via IK to a target:
tip : specifies the handle of the tip object (on the end-effector)
target : specifies the handle of the target object (the object to reach)
base : optional. Specifies the handle of the base object (the base of the kinematic chain). Defaults to -1
joints : optional. Specifies the handles of the joints involved in IK calculations. Defaults to all joints within tip and base
method : optional. Specifies the resolution method. Defaults to simIK.method_damped_least_squares
damping : optional. Specifies the resolution damping. Defaults to 0.02
iterations : optional. Specifies the max. number of iterations. Defaults to 20
constraints : optional. Specifies the constraints. Defaults to simIK.constraint_pose
precision : optional. Specifies the desired precision. Defaults to [0.001, 0.5 * math.pi / 180.0]
allowError : optional. Specifies whether a resolution with precision values over what is allowed will be applied anyway. Defaults to params.ik.allowError
breakFlags : optional. Specified the reasons-flags required for simIK.handleGroup to fail Defaults to 0
targetPose : specifies the target pose
targetVel : optional. Specifies the target velocity. Defaults to [0, ...] if omitted
flags : optional. Ruckig flags , -1 for default flags.
metric : optional. A metric to compute a pose-pose distance. If omitted, the motion calculation happens in the 4-dimensional space (dim = 4: x, y, z, angle), otherwise it happens in the 1-dimensional space (dim = 1: t)
maxVel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted
minVel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to -maxVel if omitted
maxAccel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted
minAccel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to -maxAccel if omitted
maxJerk : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed jerk as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted
callback : optional. Callback function called for each motion step. The argument provided to the callback function is the current motion state
auxData : optional. Data to be forwarded to the callback function
timeStep : optional. The desired time step size. A value of 0 indicates that the current simulation time step is used. Defaults to 0 if omitted

param.name: data
param.description: current motion state

function.name: simOpenTextEditor
function.description: Opens a text edition window. The C version of this function opens a modal window

param.name: initText
param.description: pointer to the initial text to be displayed.

param.name: xml
param.description: pointer to an XML description of the text editor's properties. Can be nullptr for default properties

param.name: various
param.description: optional pointer holding the window size (various[0]-various[1]) and position (various[2],various[3])

param.name: return
param.description: nullptr in case of an error. Otherwise a pointer to the text. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

more.code:
<editor title="Window title" editable="true" searchable="true" tabWidth="4" textColor="50 50 50" backgroundColor="190 190 190" selectionColor="128 128 255" size="800 600" position="100 100" >
<keywords1 color="152 0 0" > <item word="sim.getObject" autocomplete="true" calltip="int handle=sim.getObject(string path)" /> <item word="sim.getObjectPosition" autocomplete="true" calltip="vector3 pos=sim.getObjectPosition(int handle, int relHandle)" /> </keywords1>
<keywords2 color="220 80 20" > <item word="sim.getObjectQuaternion" autocomplete="true" calltip="quaternion quat=sim.getObjectQuaternion(int handle, int relHandle)" /> </keywords2> </editor>

function.name: sim.packDoubleTable
function.description: Packs ab array of double floating-point numbers into a string

param.name: doubleNumbers
param.description: array of double floating-point numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startDoubleIndex
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: doubleCount
param.description: amount of doubles that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available doubles should be packed from the indicated startDoubleIndex)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed double floating-point numbers

function.name: sim.packFloatTable
function.description: Packs an array of floating-point numbers into a string

param.name: floatingNumbers
param.description: array containing floating-point numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startFloatIndex
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: floatCount
param.description: amount of floats that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available floats should be packed from the indicated startFloatIndex)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed floating-point numbers

function.name: sim.packInt32Table
function.description: Packs an array of int32 numbers into a string

param.name: int32Numbers
param.description: array containing int32 numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startInt32Index
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: int32Count
param.description: amount of int32s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available int32s should be packed from the indicated startInt32Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed int32 numbers

function.name: simPackTable
function.description: Packs a table into a buffer. Functions and other non-serializable items will be packed as string or None/nil values. You can also use sim.packTable to quickly compare two tables

param.name: stackHandle
param.description: stack handle obtained with simCreateStack . There must be a table located at the top of the stack.

param.name: bufferSize
param.description: size of the returned buffer.

param.name: return
param.description: nullptr in case of an error, otherwise a data buffer. The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

function.name: sim.packTable
function.description: Packs a table into a buffer. Functions and other non-serializable items will be packed as string or None/nil values. You can also use sim.packTable to quickly compare two tables

param.name: aTable
param.description: array or map

param.name: packingScheme
param.description: 0 for CoppeliaSim format, 1 for CBOR format, 2 for CBOR format where doubles are packed as floats. When CBOR format is selected, strings with an @:txt: suffix will be forcibly packed as text, and strings with an @:dat: suffix will be forcibly packed as byte buffer

param.name: buffer
param.description: a data buffer

param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: uint16Count
param.description: amount of uint16s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available uint16s should be packed from the indicated startUint16Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed uint16 numbers

function.name: sim.packUInt32Table
function.description: Packs an array of uint32 numbers into a string

param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: uint32Count
param.description: amount of uint32s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available uint32s should be packed from the indicated startUint32Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed uint32 numbers

function.name: sim.packUInt8Table
function.description: Packs an array of uint8 numbers into a string

param.description: array containing uint8 numbers. Invalid byte number will be packed in an undefined manner.

param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

function.description: Reads the force and torque applied to a force sensor (filtered values are read)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object (must be a force sensor). Can be combined with sim.handleflag_rawvalue (simply add sim.handleflag_rawvalue to objectHandle), if you wish to access the raw values generated by each individual dynamic simulation step (by default, there are 10 dynamic simulation steps for each simulation step). Raw values can only be accessed from inside a callback function triggered by the physics engine.

param.name: forceVector
param.description: pointer to 3 values (applied forces along the sensor's x, y and z-axes). Can be nullptr

param.name: torqueVector
param.description: pointer to 3 values (applied torques about the sensor's x, y and z-axes). Can be nullptr

param.name: return
param.description:
-1 in case of an error, otherwise bit-coded:
bit 0 set (1): force and torque data is available, otherwise it is not (yet) available (e.g. when not enough values are present for the filter)

function.name: simReadProximitySensor
function.description: Reads the state of a proximity sensor. This function doesn't perform detection, it merely reads the result from a previous call to sim.handleProximitySensor

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of a proximity sensor object

param.name: detectedPoint
param.description: coordinates of the closest detected point (x, y and z: detectedPoint[0]-detectedPoint[2]) relative to the sensor reference frame, and distance to the detected point (1 value: detectedPoint[3]). Can be nullptr

param.name: detectedObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that was detected. Can be nullptr

param.name: detectedSurfaceNormalVector
param.description: normal vector (normalized) of the detected surface. Relative to the sensor reference frame. Can be nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: detection state (0 or 1), or -1 in case of an error.

function.name: simReadTexture
function.description: Retrieves the RGB data (or a portion of it) related to a specific texture

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture. See also simGetTextureId .

param.name: options
param.description: reserved for future functionality. Set to zero.

param.name: posX
param.description: x/y position of the texture portion to retrieve. Set to [0 0] to retrieve the full texture

param.name: posY
param.description: x/y size of the texture portion to retrieve. Set to [0 0] to retrieve the full texture

param.name: return
param.description: The texture data, or nullptr in case of an error. The texture data contains RGB values between 0-255 (3 bytes per pixel). The user is in charge of releasing the returned buffer with simReleaseBuffer .

function.name: sim.readTexture

param.name: posX

function.name: simReadVisionSensor
function.description: Reads the state of a vision sensor. This function doesn't perform detection, it merely reads the result from a previous call to sim.handleVisionSensor

param.name: visionSensorHandle
param.description: handle of a vision sensor object

param.name: auxValues
param.description: by default CoppeliaSim returns one packet of 15 auxiliary values: the minimum of [intensity red green blue depth], the maximum of [intensity red green blue depth], and the average of [intensity red green blue depth]. Additional packets can be appended in the vision callback function . AuxValues can be nullptr. The user is in charge of releasing the auxValues buffer with simReleaseBuffer (*auxValues).

param.name: auxValuesCount
param.description: contains information about the number of auxiliary value packets and packet sizes returned in auxValues. The first value is the number of packets, the second is the size of packet1, the third is the size of packet2, etc. Can be nullptr if auxValues is also nullptr. The user is in charge of releasing the auxValuesCount buffer with simReleaseBuffer (*auxValuesCount).

param.name: return
param.description: detection state (0 or 1), or -1 in case of an error, or if simHandleVisionSensor was never called, or if simResetVisionSensor was previously called.

function.name: simRegisterScriptCallbackFunction
function.description:
Registers a custom script function, that calls back a c/c++ function. This function is useful for plugins that wish to provide their own or customized script functions. Should be called inside of simInit entry point
Data exchange between a script and the plugin happens via a stack . Reading and writing arguments from/to the stack gives you a maximum of flexibility, and you wil be able to exchange also complex data structures. But it can also be tedious, if your data structures are anyway relatively simple. In that case you can use the helper classes
CScriptFunctionData
and
CScriptFunctionDataItem
located in
programming/include
: they will greatly simplify the task.
Use following 4 functions in the helper class:
readDataFromStack
,
getInDataPtr
,
pushOutData
and
writeDataToStack

param.name: func
param.description: name of the function, without namespace

param.name: reserved
param.description: set to nullptr

param.name: cb)
param.description: callback address that is called when the function is called from Lua. See further down for a simple way to call above function, using a helper class. The callback's first argument is a SScriptCallBack structure that holds:

param.name: return
param.description: 1 if function was registered, 0 if function was replaced (when that function name already existed), -1 in case of an error

function.name: simRegisterScriptFuncHook
function.description: Registers a script function hook for callback functions , that will be executed before or after the specified function. Calling this function a second time with the same arguments will unregister a previous hook

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: handle of the script

param.name: funcToHook
param.description: function to hook

param.name: userFunc
param.description: user function

param.name: execBefore
param.description: if true, the user function is called before the function to hook. Otherwise it is called after

param.name: options
param.description: set to 0

param.name: return
param.description: 1 if the hook registration was successful, 0 if a previous hook was removed, and -1 in case of an error

function.name: sim.registerScriptFuncHook
function.description: Registers a script function hook for callback functions , that will be executed before or after the specified function. Calling this function a second time with the same arguments will unregister a previous hook

param.name: funcToHook
param.description: function to hook

param.name: userFunc
param.description: user function

param.name: execBefore
param.description: if true, the user function is called before the function to hook. Otherwise it is called after

param.name: result
param.description: 1 if the hook registration was successful, or 0 if a previous hook was removed

function.name: simRegisterScriptVariable
function.description: Registers a script variable. Should be called inside of simInit entry point

param.name: var
param.description: name of the variable, without namespace

param.name: val
param.description: value of the variable. Can be nullptr, in which case the value of the variable will be the top item of the provided stack

param.name: stackhandle
param.description:
a stack handle obtained with simCreateStack . Set to 0 if
varValue
is not nullptr. If a stack is provided, it will be released at a later point by CoppeliaSim.

param.name: return
param.description: 1 if the variable was registered, 0 if the variable was replaced because it already existed, -1 in case of an error

function.name: simRelocateShapeFrame
function.description: Repositions and reorients the reference frame of a shape, while keeping the mesh in place. The shape's inertia properties are unaffected.

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: pose
param.description: pose for the shape's reference frame. The pose is expressed as [x y z qx qy qz qw]. A nullptr pose or a pose containing only zeros will relocate the frame to the center of the mesh's bounding box

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful. 0 if the frame could not be relocated (the frame of primitive shapes cannot be relocated), otherwise 1.

function.name: sim.relocateShapeFrame
function.description: Repositions and reorients the reference frame of a shape, while keeping the mesh in place. The shape's inertia properties are unaffected.

param.name: shapeHandle

param.name: pose
param.description: pose for the shape's reference frame. The pose is expressed as [x y z qx qy qz qw]. A pose containing only zeros relocates the frame to the center of the mesh's bounding box

param.name: result
param.description: 0 if the frame could not be relocated (the frame of primitive shapes cannot be relocated), otherwise 1.

function.name: sim.resamplePath
function.description: Returns a resampled path

param.name: path
param.description: path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D poses (position+quaternion) would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1 x2 y2 z2 qx2 qy2 qz2 qw2]

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: lengths of a path. Each path point should have a corresponding length value (as the distance from the path's first point, along the path). See also sim.getPathLengths .

param.name: finalConfigCnt
param.description: number of points or configurations the resampled path should contain

param.name: method
param.description: optional map specifying the type of interpolation (linear or quadraticBezier), and whether the path should be considered as open, even if the first and last path points overlap, and the bezier strength (0.05-1.0)

param.name: types
param.description: optional array specifying the type of each configuration value/dimension: 0=cartesian value, 1=2pi-cyclic value, 2=quaternion value. e.g. a configuration representing 3D poses should use a types argument [0 0 0 2 2 2 2], a configuration representing revolute and cyclic joints should use a types argument [1 1 1 ...]

param.name: outputPath
param.description: the resampled path

function.name: simResetDynamicObject
function.description: Dynamically resets an object that is dynamically simulated. This means that the object representation in the dynamics engine is removed, and added again. param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simRuckigPos
function.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function prepares a position-based trajectory generation object, that can then be calculated with sim.ruckigStep . When this object is not needed anymore, remove it with sim.ruckigRemove

param.name: dofs
param.description: number of degrees of freedom (n).

param.name: baseCycleTime
param.description: smallest expected cycle time. The cycle time should always be a multiple of baseCycleTime. Use a value of 0.0001 (0.1ms).

param.name: flags
param.description: Ruckig flags . -1 for default flags.

param.name: currentPos
param.description: current position (one value for each DoF)

param.name: currentVel
param.description: current velocity (one value for each DoF)

param.name: currentAccel
param.description: current acceleration (one value for each DoF)

param.name: maxVel
param.description: maximum allowed velocity (one value for each DoF, i.e. [maxV_1 ... maxV_n]). If sim.ruckig_minvel is specified in flags, then maxVel should contain [maxV_1 ... maxV_n minV_1 ... minV_n]

param.name: maxAccel
param.description: maximum allowed acceleration (one value for each DoF, i.e. [maxA_1 ... maxA_n]). If sim.ruckig_minaccel is specified in flags, then maxAccel should contain [maxA_1 ... maxA_n minA_1 ... minA_n]

param.name: maxJerk
param.description: maximum allowed jerk (one value for each DoF)

param.name: selection
param.description: selection vector (one value for each DoF). For a default behaviour, fill the vector with non-zero values.

param.name: targetPos
param.description: target position (one value for each DoF)

param.name: targetVe
param.description: target velocity (one value for each DoF)

param.name: reserved1
param.description: reserved. Set to nullptr

param.name: reserved2l
param.description: reserved. Set to nullptr

param.name: return
param.description: A negative value in case of an error, otherwise the handle of the created object

function.name: sim.ruckigPos
function.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function prepares a position-based trajectory generation object, that can then be calculated with sim.ruckigStep . When this object is not needed anymore, remove it with sim.ruckigRemove

param.name: dofs
param.description: number of degrees of freedom (n).

param.name: baseCycleTime
param.description: smallest expected cycle time. The cycle time should always be a multiple of baseCycleTime. Use a value of 0.0001 (0.1ms).

param.name: flags
param.description: Ruckig flags . -1 for default flags.

param.name: currentPosVelAccel
param.description: current position, velocity and acceleration: [pos_1 ... pos_n vel_1 ... vel_n accel_1 ... accel_n] (one value for each DoF)

param.name: maxVelAccelJerk
param.description: maximum allowed velocity, acceleration and jerk: [maxV_1 ... maxV_n maxA_1 ... maxA_n maxJ_1 ... maxJ_n]. If sim.ruckig_minvel is specified in flags, then maxVelAccelJerk should contain following additional values: [minV_1 ... minV_n]. If sim.ruckig_minaccel is specified in flags, then maxVelAccelJerk should contain following additional values: [minA_1 ... minA_n]

param.name: selection
param.description: selection vector (one value for each DoF). For a default behaviour, fill the vector with non-zero values.

param.name: targetPosVel
param.description: target position and velocity: [tPos_1 ... tPos_n tVel_1 ... tVel_n]

param.name: handle
param.description: the handle to the created object

function.name: simRuckigRemove
function.description: Removes an object previously created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the object created via simRuckigPos or simRuckigVel .

param.name: return
param.description: 1 in case of success

function.name: sim.ruckigRemove
function.description: Removes an object previously created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the object created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

function.name: simRuckigStep
function.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function steps forward a trajectory generation algorithm previously prepared via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the object created via simRuckigPos or simRuckigVel .

param.name: cycleTime
param.description: cycle time or simulation step. Should always be a multiple of the base cycle time

param.name: newPos
param.description: new position

param.name: newVel
param.description: new velocity

param.name: newAccel
param.description: new acceleration

param.name: syncTime
param.description: synchronization time (output). This is the time needed to reach the desired state. This time does not include the cycle time of the current call to sim.RuckigStep)

param.name: reserved1
param.description: reserved. Set to nullptr

param.name: reserved2
param.description: reserved. Set to nullptr

param.name: return
param.description:
-1 or -2 in case of an immediate error, otherwise the return value of the update function in the motion library:
1: Finished (final state reached)
0: Working (final state not yet reached)
-100: ErrorInvalidInput
-101: ErrorTrajectoryDuration
-110: ErrorExecutionTimeCalculation
-111: ErrorSynchronizationCalculation

function.name: sim.ruckigStep
function.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function steps forward a trajectory generation algorithm previously prepared via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the object created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

param.name: cycleTime
param.description: cycle time or simulation step. Should always be a multiple of the base cycle time

param.name: result
param.description:
return value of the update function in the motion library:
1: Result::Finished (final state reached)
0: Result::Working (final state not yet reached)
-100: Result::ErrorInvalidInput
-101: Result::ErrorTrajectoryDuration
-110: Result::ErrorExecutionTimeCalculation
-111: Result::ErrorSynchronizationCalculation

param.name: newPosVelAccel
param.description: 1: Result::Finished (final state reached)

param.name: synchronizationTime
param.description: 0: Result::Working (final state not yet reached)

function.name: sim.saveImageToBuffer
function.description: Saves an image to a buffer

param.name: image
param.description: image (in rgb, rgba or greyscale format)

param.name: resolution
param.description: x/y resolution of the provided image.

param.name: format
param.description: image format, expressed via the file extension (e.g. "jpg")

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:

function.name: simSerialOpen
function.description: Opens a serial port (RS-232) for communication. When called from a script, the function can only be called when the simulation is running (and in that case the port is automatically closed at simulation stop)

param.name: portString
param.description: string specifying the port to open. Under Windows, use something similar to "\\.\COM1". Under MacOS and Linux, use something similar to "/dev/*" (check the "/dev" folder to know what file to specify). Under Linux, you might have to launch CoppeliaSim with super user priviledges in order to access the serial port.

param.name: baudRate
param.description: baudrate

param.name: reserved1
param.description: reserved for future extension. Keep at nullptr.

param.name: reserved2
param.description: reserved for future extension. Keep at nullptr.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise a port handle

function.name: sim.serialOpen
function.description: Opens a serial port (RS-232) for communication. When called from a script, the function can only be called when the simulation is running (and in that case the port is automatically closed at simulation stop)

param.name: portString
param.description: string specifying the port to open. Under Windows, use something similar to "\\.\COM1". Under MacOS and Linux, use something similar to "/dev/*" (check the "/dev" folder to know what file to specify). Under Linux, you might have to launch CoppeliaSim with super user priviledges in order to access the serial port

param.name: baudRate
param.description: baudrate

param.name: result
param.description: the port handle

function.name: simSerialRead
function.description: Reads from a previously opened serial port (RS-232). The C version of the function cannot be blocking

param.name: portHandle
param.description: handle returned by the simSerialOpen function

param.name: buffer
param.description: buffer that will be filled with read data

param.name: dataLengthToRead
param.description: maximum data length that should be read

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the effective data length that was read

function.name: sim.serialRead
function.description: Reads from a previously opened serial port (RS-232). The C version of the function cannot be blocking

param.name: portHandle
param.description: handle returned by the sim.serialOpen function

param.name: dataLengthToRead
param.description: maximum data length that should be read

param.name: blockingOperation
param.description: if true and the calling script is running in a thread, then the function only returns when the desired data length was read (or if the closingString was met, or if there was a timeout (see next arguments)

param.name: closingString
param.description: string (containing any byte value) can be specified, that will break from the blocking operation if a match was found in the incoming data. Useful when you know that a data packet is always ended with a given signature. Can be an empty string for default operation.

param.name: timeout
param.description: duration after which the blocking operation will be aborted, or 0 if the timeout is infinite

param.name: data
param.description: a string containing read data (excluding the closingString if it was specified and found)

param.description: length of the data to be sent

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful, otherwise the effective data length that was written

function.name: sim.serialSend

param.name: data
param.description: pointer to the data that should be sent

param.name: charsSent
param.description: the effective data length that was written

function.name: simSetObjectMatrix
function.description: Sets the transformation matrix of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the matrix is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute transformation matrix, sim.handle_inverse to set the inverse of the absolute transformation matrix, sim.handle_parent to set the transformation matrix relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the transformation matrix is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the matrix is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the matrix is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

param.name: matrix
param.description: the matrix (array of 12 values [Vx0 Vy0 Vz0 P0 Vx1 Vy1 Vz1 P1 Vx2 Vy2 Vz2 P2])

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simSetObjectOrientation
function.description: Sets the orientation ( Euler angles ) of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the orientation is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute orientation, sim.handle_inverse to set the inverse of the absolute orientation, sim.handle_parent to set the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the orientation is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the orientation is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the orientation is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

param.name: eulerAngles
param.description: Euler angles (alpha, beta and gamma)

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simGetRotationAxis
function.description: Retrieves an axis and rotation angle that brings one pose or transformation matrix onto another one. The translation part of the poses/matrices is ignored. This function, when used in combination with simRotateAroundAxis , can be used to build interpolations between transformation matrices

param.name: matrixStart
param.description:
the
start
transformation matrix (array of 12 values [Vx0 Vy0 Vz0 P0 Vx1 Vy1 Vz1 P1 Vx2 Vy2 Vz2 P2])

param.name: matrixGoal
param.description:
the
goal
transformation matrix (array of 12 values [Vx0 Vy0 Vz0 P0 Vx1 Vy1 Vz1 P1 Vx2 Vy2 Vz2 P2])

param.name: axis
param.description: the returned rotation axis in absolute coordinates (array of 3 values [Vx Vy Vz])

param.name: angle
param.description: the returned rotation angle

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simRotateAroundAxis
function.description: Rotates a pose or transformation matrix around a random axis in space. This function, when used in combination with simGetRotationAxis , can be used to build interpolations between poses or transformation matrices

param.name: matrixIn
param.description: transformation matrix to rotate (array of 12 values [Vx0 Vy0 Vz0 P0 Vx1 Vy1 Vz1 P1 Vx2 Vy2 Vz2 P2])

param.name: axis
param.description: axis vector in absolute coordinates to rotate around

param.name: axisPos
param.description: position of the rotation axis in absolute coordinates

param.name: angle
param.description: amount of rotation to perform

param.name: matrixOut
param.description: returned transformed (rotated) matrix (array of 12 values [Vx0 Vy0 Vz0 P0 Vx1 Vy1 Vz1 P1 Vx2 Vy2 Vz2 P2])

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simSetObjectParent
function.description: Sets an object's parent object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that will become child of the parent object. Can be or-combined with sim_handleflag_assembly if an assembly operation is desired instead (in that case, can't be -1, and should be set to false)

param.name: parentObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that will become parent, or -1 if the object should become parentless. In an assembly operation, the assembly dummy on the parent object should be specified instead

param.name: keepInPlace
param.description: indicates whether the object's absolute pose should stay same

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simSetObjectPose
function.description: Sets the pose of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Combine with sim.handleflag_wxyzquat to provide the quaternion as [qw qx qy qz] order instead of [qx qy qz qw] order. Can also be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the pose is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute pose, sim.handle_inverse to set the inverse of the absolute pose, sim.handle_parent to set the pose relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the pose is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the pose is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the pose is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

param.name: pose
param.description: the pose (array of 7 values [x y z qx qy qz qw])

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

function.name: simSetObjectPosition
function.description: Sets the position (x, y and z-coordinates) of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the position is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute position, sim.handle_parent to set the position relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the position is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the position is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the position is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

param.name: position
param.description: coordinates of the object

param.name: return
param.description: -1 if operation was not successful

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the orientation is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute orientation, sim.handle_inverse to set the inverse of the absolute orientation, sim.handle_parent to set the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the orientation is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the quaternion is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the quaternion is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep unset
bit3 set (8): do not use an OC tree structure. When enabled, point cloud operations are limited, and point clouds will not be collidable , measurable or detectable anymore, but adding points will be much faster
bit4 set (16): color is emissive

param.name: pointSize
param.description: bit0 set (1): points have random colors

param.name: reserved
param.description: bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure

param.name: return
param.description: 1 if operation was successful

function.name: sim.setPointCloudOptions
function.description: Sets various properties of a point cloud

param.name: pcHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: maxVoxelSize
param.description: maximum size of the OC tree voxels containing points

param.name: maxPtCntPerVoxel
param.description: maximum number of points allowed in a same OC tree voxel

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): points have random colors
bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep unset
bit3 set (8): do not use an OC tree structure. When enabled, point cloud operations are limited, and point clouds will not be collidable , measurable or detectable anymore, but adding points will be much faster
bit4 set (16): color is emissive

param.name: pointSize
param.description: bit0 set (1): points have random colors

function.name: simSetReferencedHandles
function.description:
Attaches a list of custom handles to a given scene object. Those custom handles are handles of other scene objects, that are linked to the given scene object (for whatever purpose). The advantage of storing references to other objects with this function is that CoppeliaSim will take care of correctly adjusting the references if needed: For instance, imagine
objectA
storing the handle of
objectB
via this function. If
objectB
is deleted, then the stored handle becomes -1. If
objectA
and
objectB
are duplicated at the same time, then the duplicate of
objectA
stores the handle of the duplicate of
objectB
. Optionally, if
sim.handleflag_keeporiginal
is specified, then linking to original objects is guaranteed, e.g. in above example, after a duplication of
objectA
, the duplicate of
objectA
will store the handle of the original
objectB
(if
objectB
still exists)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description:
handle of the scene object that will store the list of handles. Can be optionally combined with
sim.handleflag_keeporiginal
, in which case the handles that link to originals are retrieved

param.name: count
param.description: number of handles to store

param.name: referencedHandles
param.description: list of scene object handles.

param.name: tag
param.description: a tag: handles will be stored under this tag. nullptr defaults to an empty tag

param.name: reserved
param.description: reserved for future extensions

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error.

function.name: simSetShapeTexture
function.description: Applies/removes a texture to/from a shape

param.name: h
param.description: handle of the shape.

param.name: tId
param.description: ID of the texture or -1 to remove any existing texture. See also simGetTextureId , simGetShapeTextureId and simCreateTexture .

param.name: mode
param.description: texture mapping mode .

param.name: opt
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated.
bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions).
bit2: if set (4), then the texture will be repeated along the U direction.
bit3: if set (8), then the texture will be repeated along the V direction.

param.name: uvScaling
param.description: bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated.

param.name: pos
param.description: bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions).

param.name: orient
param.description: bit2: if set (4), then the texture will be repeated along the U direction.

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error.

function.name: sim.unpackDoubleTable

param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be unpacked (from data[8*startDoubleIndex+1+additionalByteOffset]). Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: doubleCount
param.description: amount of doubles that should be unpacked. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum of doubles should be unpacked from the indicated startIndex)

param.name: additionalByteOffset
param.description: byte offset that will be added before reading the doubless. Can be omitted, in which case 0 is used.

param.name: doubleNumbers
param.description: array containing unpacked double floating-point numbers

param.name: floatCount

param.name: additionalByteOffset

param.name: floatingNumbers
param.description: array containing unpacked floating-point numbers

function.name: sim.wait
function.description: Waits for a certain amount of time

param.name: deltaTime
param.description: minimum time duration to wait

param.name: simulationTime
param.description: indicates whether we want to wait in terms of simulation- or real-time

param.name: deltaTimeLeft
param.description: "wait resolution" of this function is the simulation time step, and the sim.wait command may overshoot the requested waiting time. deltaTimeLeft is the negative overshoot time. If the function was called at simulation time X, and the function returned at simulation time Y, then deltaTimeLeft is deltaTime-(Y-X). deltaTimeLeft is also memorized internally on a thread-basis and used as compensation or correction factor in subsequent blocking commands. deltaTimeLeft is 0 if the simulationTime argument was false

function.name: simWriteTexture
function.description: Overwrites a specific texture (or a portion of it) with RGB data

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture. See also simGetTextureId

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 reserved. Do not set
bit1 reserved. Do not set
bit2 set (4)=only an elliptical/circular portion of the texture data will be written

param.name: textureData
param.description: reserved. Do not set

param.name: posX
param.description: reserved. Do not set

param.name: posY
param.description: set (4)=only an elliptical/circular portion of the texture data will be written

param.name: sizeX
param.description: RGB data to write onto the texture. Each pixel is represented with 3 bytes (0-255)

param.name: sizeY
param.description: x/y position where to copy the RGB data. Set to 0/0 to overwrite the full texture

param.name: interpolation
param.description: x/y size of the RGB data. Set to 0/0 to overwrite the full texture

param.name: return
param.description: -1 in case of an error.
