function.name: sim.setEventFilters
function.description: Specifies filters for the sysCall_event callback. Operates on a per script basis

param.name: filters

function.name: sim.addDrawingObjectItem
function.description: Adds an item (or clears all items) to a previously inserted drawing object

param.name: drawingObjectHandle
param.description: handle of a previously added drawing object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_addmultiple to add several drawing items at once, or with sim.handleflag_codedstring, when one wishes to provide data as a float buffer

param.name: itemData
param.description: data relative to an item. If the item is a point item, 3 values are required [x y z]. If the item is a line item, 6 values are required, etc. None/nil to empty the drawing object

function.name: sim.addForceAndTorque
function.description: Adds a force and/or torque to a shape object that is dynamically enabled. Forces are applied at the center of mass. Added forces and torques are cumulative, and are reset to zero after sim.handleDynamics was called (or by using the following flags: sim.handleflag_resetforce and/or sim.handleflag_resettorque)

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of a dynamically enabled shape. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_resetforce and/or sim.handleflag_resettorque in order to clear the accumulated force or torque.

param.name: force
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the force (in absolute coordinates) to add. Can be None/nil

param.name: torque
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the torque (in absolute coordinates) to add. Can be None/nil

function.name: sim.addToCollection
function.description: Adds an item to a collection

param.name: collectionHandle
param.description: handle of a collection.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of an object

param.name: what
param.description:
type of object (or group of objects) to add. Following are allowed values:
sim.handle_single (for a single object)
sim.handle_all (for all objects in the scene)
sim.handle_tree (for a tree of objects)
sim.handle_chain (for a chain of objects (i.e. an inverted tree)).

param.name: options
param.description: sim.handle_single (for a single object)

function.name: sim.removeFromCollection
function.description: Removes an item from a collection

param.name: collectionHandle
param.description: handle of a collection.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of an object

param.name: what
param.description:
type of object (or group of objects) to remove. Following are allowed values:
sim.handle_single (for a single object)
sim.handle_all (for all objects in the scene)
sim.handle_tree (for a tree of objects)
sim.handle_chain (for a chain of objects (i.e. an inverted tree)).

param.name: options
param.description: sim.handle_single (for a single object)

function.name: sim.auxiliaryConsolePrint
function.description: Prints to an auxiliary console window

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description: handle of the console window, previously returned by the sim.auxiliaryConsoleOpen

param.name: text
param.description: text to append, or an empty string to clear the console window

function.name: sim.broadcastMsg
function.description: Broadcasts a message to all scripts, except for the emitting script. Messages are received synchronously via the sysCall_msg callback function

param.name: message
param.description: message to broadcast. Best is to use following skeleton message: message = {'id': 'msgIdentifyingString', 'data': [...]}

param.name: options
param.description: not used, keep at 0

function.name: sim.initScript
function.description: Initializes/reinitializes a script. Operates in an asynchronous way when called upon the calling script

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: handle of the script to initialize/reinitialize

function.name: sim.launchExecutable
function.description: Launches an executable. Similar to os.execute or io.popen, but is system independent

param.name: filename
param.description: file name of the executable. If the filename starts with '@', then it will be considered as a system command, otherwise the current directory might be automatically prepended to the filename if it makes sense.

param.name: parameters
param.description: optional input arguments

param.name: showStatus
param.description: 0 to hide the application's window, 1 to show it. Works only with Windows OS.

function.name: sim.pushUserEvent
function.description: Pushes a user-triggered event. Messages are received asynchronously via the sysCall_event callback function and via the plugin sim_message_eventcallback_events message call

param.name: event
param.description: event name

param.name: handle
param.description: optional handle associated with the event. Can be -1

param.name: eventData
param.description: optional unique id associated with the event. Can be -1

param.name: options
param.description: event data

function.name: sim.removeObjects
function.description: Removes one or several objects from the scene

param.name: objectHandles
param.description: handles of the objects to remove

param.name: delayedRemoval
param.description: whether the removal should be delayed (e.g. when a script destroys itself). Defaults to false

function.name: sim.saveImage
function.description: Saves an image to file

param.name: image
param.description: image (in rgb, rgba or greyscale format)

param.name: resolution
param.description: x/y resolution of the provided image.

param.name: filename
param.description: name of the file to write. The file extension indicates the format

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 - bit1: format of the provided image (0=rgb, 1=rgba, 2=greyscale)

param.name: quality
param.description: bit0 - bit1: format of the provided image (0=rgb, 1=rgba, 2=greyscale)

function.name: sim.scaleObject
function.description: Scales specified objects in a non-isometric fashion, if possible. Only non-compound shapes can be non-isometrically scaled. Some primitive shapes can have some constraints between their axes

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object to scale

param.name: xScale
param.description: scaling factors along the object's x, y and z-axis

param.name: yScale
param.description: keep at 0

function.name: sim.setGraphStreamTransformation
function.description: Applies a transformation to a graph stream

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph

param.name: streamId
param.description: id of the stream

param.name: mult
param.description: multiplication factor

param.name: off
param.description: an offset

param.name: movingAvgPeriod
param.description: moving average period. Set to 1 for no moving average

function.name: sim.setJointTargetForce
function.description: Sets the force or torque that a joint can exert

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the joint object

param.name: forceOrTorque
param.description: maximum force or torque the joint can exert

param.name: signedValue
param.description: if true, the sign of the force/torque indicates the desired movement direction

function.name: sim.setJointTargetPosition
function.description: Sets the target linear/angular position of a joint. When in kinematic mode, the joint moves according to a motion profile that respects maximum velocity, acceleration and jerk values. In dynamic and position/custom control mode, the controller is instructed about the desired position

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the joint object

param.name: targetPosition
param.description: target position of the joint

param.name: motionParams
param.description: when in kinematic mode: the maximum allowed velocity, acceleration and jerk. When in dynamics mode with position control and motion profile enabled, the maximum allowed velocity, acceleration and jerk. Can be None/nil for default values. See also the maxVelAccelJerk property

function.name: sim.setJointTargetVelocity
function.description: Sets the target linear/angular velocity of a non-spherical joint. When in kinematic mode, the joint moves according to a motion profile that respects maximum acceleration and jerk values. In dynamic and velocity control mode, the controller is instructed about the desired velocity

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the joint object

param.name: targetVelocity
param.description: target velocity of the joint

param.name: motionParams
param.description: when the joint is in kinematic mode: the maximum allowed acceleration and jerk. When in dynamic mode with motion profile control enabled: the maximum allowed acceleration and jerk. Can be None/nil for default values. See also the maxVelAccelJerk property

function.name: sim.setObjectParent
function.description: Sets an object's parent object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
parentObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that will become parent, or -1 if the object should become parentless. In an assembly operation, the assembly dummy on the parent object should be specified instead

param.name: keepInPlace
param.description: indicates whether the object's absolute pose should stay same

function.name: sim.setObjectPose
function.description: Sets the pose of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Combine with sim.handleflag_wxyzquat to provide the quaternion as [qw qx qy qz] order instead of [qx qy qz qw] order. Can also be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: p
param.description: the pose: [x, y, z, qx, qy, qz, qw])

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the pose is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute pose, sim.handle_inverse to set the inverse of the absolute pose, sim.handle_parent to set the pose relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the pose is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the pose is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the pose is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

function.name: sim.setObjectPosition
function.description: Sets the position (x, y and z-coordinates) of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: pos
param.description: the object position

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the position is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute position, sim.handle_parent to set the position relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the position is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the position is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the position is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

function.name: sim.setObjectQuaternion
function.description: Sets the quaternion of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Combine with sim.handleflag_wxyzquat to provide the quaternion as [qw qx qy qz] order instead of [qx qy qz qw] order. Can also be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: quat
param.description: the quaternion: [qx, qy, qz, qw]

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the orientation is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute orientation, sim.handle_parent to set the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the orientation is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the quaternion is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the quaternion is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

function.name: sim.setReferencedHandles
function.description: Attaches a list of custom handles to a given scene object. Those custom handles are handles of other scene objects, that are linked to the given scene object (for whatever purpose). The advantage of storing references to other objects with this function is that CoppeliaSim will take care of correctly adjusting the references if needed: For instance, imagine objectA storing the handle of objectB via this function. If objectB is deleted, then the stored handle becomes -1. If objectA and objectB are duplicated at the same time, then the duplicate of objectA stores the handle of the duplicate of objectB . Optionally, if sim.handleflag_keeporiginal is specified, then linking to original objects is guaranteed, e.g. in above example, after a duplication of objectA , the duplicate of objectA will store the handle of the original objectB (if objectB still exists)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the scene object that will store the list of handles. Can be optionally combined with sim.handleflag_keeporiginal , in which case the handles that link to originals are retrieved

param.name: referencedHandles
param.description: list of scene object handles.

param.name: tag
param.description: a tag: handles will be stored under this tag. Defaults to an empty tag

function.name: sim.setShapeTexture
function.description: Applies/removes a texture to/from a shape

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape.

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture or -1 to remove any existing texture. See also sim.getTextureId , sim.getShapeTextureId and sim.createTexture

param.name: mappingMode
param.description: texture mapping mode .

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated.
bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions).
bit2: if set (4), then the texture will be repeated along the U direction.
bit3: if set (8), then the texture will be repeated along the V direction.

param.name: uvScaling
param.description: bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated.

param.name: position
param.description: bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions).

param.name: orientation
param.description: bit2: if set (4), then the texture will be repeated along the U direction.

function.name: sim.setVisionSensorImg
function.description: Writes the image of a vision sensor (and applies any image processing via the vision callback functions ). Make sure the vision sensor is flagged as external input

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor object

param.name: image
param.description: buffer containing the image

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the provided image is a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image (3 bytes per pixel)
bit1 set (2): the provided image has one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: pos
param.description: bit0 set (1): the provided image is a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image (3 bytes per pixel)

param.name: size
param.description: bit1 set (2): the provided image has one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

function.name: sim.writeTexture
function.description: Overwrites a specific texture (or a portion of it) with RGB data

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture. See also sim.getTextureId

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 reserved. Do not set
bit1 reserved. Do not set
bit2 set (4)=only an elliptical/circular portion of the texture data will be written

param.name: textureData
param.description: reserved. Do not set

param.name: posX
param.description: reserved. Do not set

param.name: posY
param.description: set (4)=only an elliptical/circular portion of the texture data will be written

param.name: sizeX
param.description: RGB data to write onto the texture. Each pixel is represented with 3 bytes (0-255)

param.name: sizeY
param.description: x/y position where to copy the RGB data. Set to 0/0 to overwrite the full texture

param.name: interpolation
param.description: x/y size of the RGB data. Set to 0/0 to overwrite the full texture
